a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= versus against , used in the names of legal trials, or in Britain when talking about games in which two teams or players play against each other 对﹐诉﹐对抗〔用于法庭审讯或在英国用于谈论体育比赛〕

Sense.DEF: a university vacation13

Sense.DEF: a room in a hotel or building that is not being used and is available for someone to stay in

Sense.DEF: lack of interest or thought

Sense.DEF: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was only a vacant lot empty unused area of land in a city where her house used to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前房子所在的地方只剩下一块空地了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a seat or room is free rather than vacant.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表达座位或房间空着﹐人们通常说 free﹐而不说 vacant

Sense.DEF: a job or position in an organization that is vacant is available for someone to start doing

GramExa.GLOSS: become vacant
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was offered the position of headmaster when it fell vacant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长职位空出来以后给了他。

GramExa.GLOSS: the part of a newspaper where jobs are advertised

Sense.DEF: an expression that shows that someone does not seem to be thinking about anything
Sense.TRAN: 茫然的表情/神情/凝视等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gazed at me with vacant eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用茫然的眼神看着我。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Cindy was staring vacantly into space.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪茫然地凝视着前方。

Sense.DEF: a home or other building whose previous owner has left, so that the new owner can move into it immediately
Sense.TRAN: 闲置房屋/公寓〔指原房主已经搬离﹑新房主可立即迁入的住宅等〕

Sense.DEF: to leave a job or position so that it is available for someone else to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clay will vacate the position on June 19.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱将于6月19日离职。

Sense.DEF: to leave a seat, room etc so that someone else can use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests must vacate their rooms by 11:00.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房客必须于11点前腾出房间。

Sense.DEF: a holiday, or time spent not working
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re planning a vacation in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正计划去欧洲度假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s on vacation this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期他休假。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re planning to go on vacation soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在计划近期去度假。

Sense.DEF: the number of days, weeks etc that you are allowed as paid holiday by your employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much vacation do you get at your new job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的新工作有多少天的带薪假期？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I have four vacation days left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我还剩下四天带薪假期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees are entitled to four weeks’ paid vacation annually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工每年享有四周的带薪假期。

Subsense.DEF: one of the periods of time when a university is closed

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 圣诞节假期/复活节假期/暑假/长假

Subsense.DEF: one of the periods of time when a school or university is closed

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the nouns holiday and vacation are in British and American English. 本图表显示名词holiday和vacation在英国英语和美国英语中的使用频率。

In British English the word holiday is used to mean a time of rest from work or school, or a period of time when you travel to another place for pleasure. Americans use vacation for this meaning, and to refer to a period when universities are closed. In both American and British English holiday is used to mean a day fixed by law on which people do not have to go to work or school. In British English vacation is used to refer to a period when universities are closed.在英国英语中holiday用于表示不上班或中小学不上学的假期﹐也指旅游度假。美国英语用vacation表示这个意思﹐也用vacation表示大学的假期。英国英语和美国英语都用holiday表示法定的节日。在英国英语中﹐vacation表示大学的假期。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We usually take a vacation once a year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通常每年休假一次。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m going on vacation next month.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下个月去度假。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’re working too hard. You need a vacation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你工作太辛苦了﹐需要休假。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What did you do on your summer vacation?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你暑假做了些什么事？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had to cancel the family vacation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不取消全家度假的计划。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She decided to take a long vacation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定休一个长假。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a place for a vacation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The island is my favorite vacation spot.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座岛是我最喜爱的度假胜地。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a day away from work on vacation

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘have vacation’. Say 而要说 be on vacation.

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere for a holiday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Bernsteins are vacationing in Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯恩斯坦一家正在欧洲度假。

Sense.DEF: someone who has gone somewhere for a holiday
to protect a person or animal from a disease by giving them a vaccine
Sense.TRAN: 给…接种疫苗﹐给…打预防针

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All children should be vaccinated against measles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有儿童都应该接种麻疹疫苗。

Sense.DEF: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

Sense.DEF: to continue to change your opinions, decisions, ideas etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents vacillated between different approaches to discipline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母在不同的管教方式之间摇摆不定。

Sense.DEF: an actor who seems like a real person, but who is an image made using a computer
lack of intelligent, interesting, or serious thought
showing no intelligence or having no useful purpose
Sense.TRAN: 无知的﹔空洞的﹔没有意义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vacuous expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茫然的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vacuous romantic novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空洞的爱情小说

Sense.DEF: a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away
a vacuum cleaner

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her husband’s death left a vacuum in her life.

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the political vacuum caused by the ban on Communist Party activity

Sense.DEF: existing completely separately from other people or things and having no connection with them

Sense.EXAMPLE: The process of learning a language does not take place in a vacuum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习语言的过程在封闭状态下无法进行。

Sense.DEF: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
Sense.TRAN: 用真空吸尘器打扫［清洁］

Sense.DEF: a machine that cleans floors by sucking up dirt
a special container that keeps liquids hot or cold
vacuum-packed food is in a container from which most of the air has been removed, so that the food will stay fresh for longer
avalve3
someone who has no home and travels from place to place
unexpected changes in a situation or someone’s behaviour, that you cannot control but which have an effect on your life
Sense.TRAN: 〔局面﹑行为中的〕不可捉摸[异常]的变化﹔变化莫测

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vagaries of the English weather

Sense.DEF: the passage between a woman’s outer sexual organs and her uterus
the criminal offence of living on the street and begging from people
someone who has no home or work, especially someone who begs

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julia was vague about where she had been and what she had been doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于她到过哪里﹐做了些什么﹐朱莉娅含糊其词。

Sense.DEF: to think that something might be true or that you remember something, although you cannot be sure

Sense.DEF: not having a clear shape or form

Sense.DEF: slightly

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我依稀记得一个穿红色连衣裙的女人站在门外。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身上有种似曾相识的感觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was vaguely aware of another figure by the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我隐约意识到门边还有一个人。

Sense.DEF: not clearly or exactly

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声明措辞十分含糊。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you are not thinking about what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smiled vaguely at the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对着天花板心不在焉地笑了笑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is vain is too proud of their good looks, abilities, or position – used to show disapproval

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

Subsense.DEF: without success in spite of your efforts
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.

Subsense.DEF: without purpose or without positive results
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Altman swore that his son’s death would not be in vain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔特曼发誓他的儿子不会白死。

Sense.DEF: a vain attempt, hope, or search fails to achieve the result you wanted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The young mother died in a vain attempt to save her drowning son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位年轻的母亲没能救起溺水的儿子﹐自己也淹死了。

Sense.DEF: a threat, promise etc that is not worrying because the person cannot do what they say they will

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The instructor struggled vainly to open his parachute.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 教官拼命想打开降落伞﹐但没有成功。

Sense.DEF: too proud of your own abilities, importance etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常自负的﹐自命不凡的

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of cloth that hangs from the edge of a shelf or from the frame of a bed to the floor
Sense.TRAN: 〔挂在架子边缘﹑床沿等的〕挂帘﹐短帷幔﹐挂布

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of cloth above a window, covering the rail the curtains hang on
a broad low valley
an expression used to mean the difficulties of life
Sense.TRAN: 生活的磨难﹐烦恼的尘世

Sense.DEF: the act of saying goodbye, especially in a formal speech

Sense.DEF: the student who has received the best marks all the way through school, and who usually makes a speech at the graduation ceremony

Sense.DEF: a speech or statement in which you say goodbye when you are leaving a school, job etc, especially on a formal occasion

Sense.DEF: a measure of the power of atoms to combine together to form compounds
another spelling of valance
someone you love or think is attractive, that you send a card to on St Valentine’s Day
Sense.TRAN: 〔在圣瓦伦丁节(2月14日)向其赠送贺卡的〕情人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be my valentine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做我的情人吧。

Sense.DEF: a card you send to someone on St Valentine’s Day
Sense.TRAN: 圣瓦伦丁节贺卡﹐情人卡

Sense.DEF: a male servant who looks after a man’s clothes, serves his meals etc
someone who parks your car for you at a restaurant, hotel etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐厅或酒店等场所〕为客人停车的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: valet service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代客泊车服务

Sense.DEF: someone who cleans the clothes of people staying in a hotel
Sense.TRAN: 〔为酒店客人洗衣服的〕服务员

Sense.DEF: to clean someone’s car
Sense.EXAMPLE: a valeting service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗车服务

Sense.DEF: the service of having someone else park your car for you at a restaurant, hotel etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tarr threw himself in front of a train in a valiant effort to save the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔尔勇敢地冲到火车前去救那个小孩。

Sense.DEF: a valid ticket, document, or agreement is legally or officially acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a valid credit card
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有效信用卡
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

Sense.DEF: a reason, argument etc that is based on what is reasonable or sensible

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

Sense.DEF: a valid password, id etc is one that will be accepted by a computer system
Sense.TRAN: 〔密码﹑账号等〕系统认可的﹐有效的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I would question the validity of that statement.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我质疑那种说法的正确性。

Sense.DEF: to prove that something is true or correct, or to make a document or agreement officially and legally acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Supreme Court has validated the lower court’s interpretation of the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院已经认可下级法院对这条法规的阐释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many scientists plan to wait until the results of the study are validated by future research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多科学家计划等到调查结果被今后的研究证实了以后再作定论。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that their ideas and feelings are respected and considered seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talking with people who think like you helps validate your feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和想法相似的人交谈可以让你的情感得到认同。

Sense.DEF: if a business validates a ticket from a parking garage, it puts a special mark on it, showing that it will pay the parking costs
Sense.TRAN: 承认﹐认可〔停车卡﹐即在上面盖章表示同意支付停车费〕

Sense.DEF: a small suitcase
a drug that makes people feel calmer and less anxious
an area of lower land between two lines of hills or mountains, usually with a river flowing through it
Sense.TRAN: 谷﹔山谷〔通常有河流流过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the San Fernando Valley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣费尔南多山谷

Sense.DEF: great courage, especially in war
Sense.EXAMPLE: medals awarded for valor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表彰英勇的勋章
Sense.EXAMPLE: deeds of valour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英勇事迹

Sense.DEF: worth a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a valuable painting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅名贵的画
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their most valuable belongings were locked in a safe in the bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最值钱的财物锁在卧室保险箱里。

Sense.DEF: valuable help, advice, information etc is very useful because it helps you to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助﹑建议﹑信息等〕宝贵的﹐有价值的﹐有用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Muriel has made a valuable contribution to our company’s success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缪里尔为我们公司的成功做出了宝贵的贡献。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job that gave him valuable experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给了他宝贵经验的工作

Sense.DEF: important because there is only a limited amount available
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t waste any more of your valuable time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会再浪费你的宝贵时间了。

Section.SECHEADING: WORTH A LOT OF MONEY 非常值钱的

Exponent.DEF: worth a lot of money and expensive to buy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a valuable piece of jewellery
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件贵重的珠宝
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The carpet is extremely valuable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地毯极其贵重。

Exponent.DEF: so valuable that it is impossible to calculate a price
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a priceless painting by Rembrandt
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦勃朗的无价画作
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The statue is priceless.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座雕塑是无价之宝。

Exponent.DEF: precious metals such as gold, or stones such as diamonds are very rare and expensive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Back in ancient times, coins contained precious metals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 古时候﹐钱币中含有贵金属。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ring was set with dozens of precious stones.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那枚戒指镶着数十颗宝石。

Exponent.DEF: to be worth a very large amount of money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some rare baseball cards are worth a fortune.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些少见的棒球卡值很多钱。

Section.SECHEADING: VERY SPECIAL AND IMPORTANT 非常特殊﹑重要

Exponent.DEF: very special and important to someone – used about people or things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My family have always been precious to me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭对我来说一直是非常宝贵的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His free time was very precious to him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空闲时间对他来说十分宝贵。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the place where I kept my most precious things
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我存放珍贵物品的地方

Exponent.DEF: a prized object is very special and important to someone, so that they want very much to keep it or obtain it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物品〕非常重要的﹐极受珍视的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was one of his most prized possessions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书是他最宝贵的财产之一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shells are prized for their beauty are considered to be very special.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些贝壳因美丽而受到珍视。

Exponent.DEF: very special and important to someone, especially because it is connected with someone they love
Exponent.TRAN: 珍贵的﹐珍爱的〔尤因其与自己所爱的人有关〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the case in which she kept her most treasured possessions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她存放最珍贵物品的盒子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The holiday was now a treasured memory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个假期现在是一段珍贵的回忆。

Exponent.DEF: extremely special and important, especially because it is the only one of its kind
Exponent.TRAN: 独一无二的﹐不可代替的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The manuscripts are said to be irreplaceable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说那些手稿是独一无二的。

Sense.DEF: things that you own that are worth a lot of money, such as jewellery, cameras etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests should leave their valuables in the hotel safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客人应把贵重物品存放在酒店保险柜中。

Sense.DEF: a professional judgment about how much something is worth
Sense.EXAMPLE: The property has a valuation of $1.6 billion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那处房地产估价为16亿美元。

Sense.DEF: a judgment about how effective or useful a particular idea or plan will be
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某个想法﹑计划的〕评价﹐评估

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that something is worth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is worth what you pay for it, or not worth what you pay for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lunch special is really good value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特价午餐非常合算。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At only £45 a night, the hotel is great value for money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家酒店每晚只要45英镑﹐非常划算。

GramExa.GLOSS: good value, or the quality of being good value
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every customer is looking for value for money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每位顾客都想买到划算的东西。

Sense.DEF: the importance or usefulness of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A group of athletes spoke to the students about the value of a college education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个运动员向学生谈及大学教育的重要性。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the nutritional value of cereal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谷类食物的营养价值

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His research has been of little practical value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的研究没有什么实用价值。

GramExa.PROPFORM: place/put a high value on sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Sioux Indians placed a high value on generosity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏族印第安人非常看重为人慷慨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The locket has great sentimental value importance because it was a gift, it reminds you of someone etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个盒式项链坠很有纪念意义。

Subsense.DEF: worth a lot of money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The thieves took nothing of value.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼们没有偷走值钱的东西。

Subsense.DEF: useful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I hope this book will be of value to both teachers and students.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望这本书对教师和学生都有帮助。

Sense.DEF: a good or interesting quality that something has because it is surprising, different, new etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the initial curiosity value, the product’s sales dropped considerably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当人们最初的好奇感过去以后﹐这个产品便销量大跌。

Sense.DEF: your ideas about what is right and wrong, or what is important in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a return to traditional values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回归传统的价值观
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your attitudes about sex are affected by your religious and moral values.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对于性的看法受到自己的宗教价值观和道德价值观的影响。

Sense.DEF: a mathematical quantity shown by a letter of the alphabet or sign
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let x have the value 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设x的值为25。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dollar has been steadily increasing in value.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元一直在稳步升值。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a risk that the shares may fall in value.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些股票有贬值的风险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The house doubled in value over two years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年来这房子的价值翻了一番。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say how much it is worth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to put a value on something so unusual.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这么不寻常的东西很难估价。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The value of the land had increased by $2m.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地增值了200万美元。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: its value does not fall over time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should insure any goods of high value.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值高的物品均应购买保险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The low value of the dollar will benefit tourists.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元走低对游客有利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the amount something can be sold for
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The mortgage is more than the house’s current market value.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 按揭额已高出房子的当前市值。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the value of something in money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They made an attempt to assess the cash value of the contract.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图评估该合同的现金价值。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: its value after considering inflation
the amount that users will pay for illegal drugs

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a sudden drop in the value of oil.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格突然下跌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We saw a rapid increase in the land’s value.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们曾经历土地迅速升值。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘sth is value’ or 或 ‘sth is very value’. Say 而要说 sth is good value or 或 sth is very good value.

Sense.DEF: to think that someone or something is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shelley valued her privacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢利很重视自己的隐私。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr. Yeo valued Jan for her hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约先生因简工作努力而十分看重她。

Sense.DEF: to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to get the house valued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paintings valued at over $200,000 were stolen from her home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几幅估价为二十多万美元的画从她家里被盗走了。

Sense.DEF: a decision or judgment about how good something is, based on your personal opinions not facts
Sense.TRAN: 价值判断〔根据主观意见而不是事实所作的判断〕

Sense.DEF: worth no money or very little money
Sense.EXAMPLE: valueless currency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不值钱的货币

Sense.DEF: having no worth, importance, or good qualities
Sense.TRAN: 没有价值的﹔不重要的﹔质量差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: On most political issues my own opinion was pretty well valueless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大多数政治问题上﹐我个人的观点很不重要。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to decide how much money something is worth
a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: heart valves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏瓣膜

Sense.DEF: the part on a trumpet or similar musical instrument that you press to change the sound of the note
a closed glass tube used to control the flow of electricity in old radios, televisions etc
a woman who uses her sexual attractiveness to make men do what she wants
Sense.TRAN: 〔利用色相勾引并利用男子的〕妖妇﹐荡妇

Sense.DEF: in stories, a dead person that sucks people’s blood by biting their necks
a South American bat that sucks the blood of other animals
Sense.TRAN: 吸血蝙蝠〔产于南美的一种蝙蝠〕

Sense.DEF: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delivery van
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运货车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a van driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型货车司机

Sense.DEF: a large box-like car that can carry a lot of people
a railway carriage with a roof and sides, used especially for carrying goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: a luggage van
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行李车

Sense.DEF: to be one of the people who are in front or who are leading a change
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in the van of the feminist movement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她处于女权运动的前沿。

Sense.DEF: someone who deliberately damages things, especially public property
Sense.TRAN: 故意破坏财物〔尤指公物〕者

Sense.DEF: the crime of deliberately damaging things, especially public property
Sense.TRAN: 故意破坏财物〔尤指公物〕的行为

Sense.DEF: to damage or destroy things deliberately, especially public property
Sense.TRAN: 故意破坏〔财物﹐尤指公物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cemetery was vandalized during the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公墓在夜间遭到了破坏。

Sense.DEF: a flat blade that is moved by wind or water to produce power to drive a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔靠风力或水力驱动﹑为机器产生动力的〕翼﹐叶片

Sense.DEF: in the most advanced position of development
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop has always been in the vanguard of London fashion trends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家商店一直走在伦敦时尚潮流的最前沿。

Sense.DEF: the leading position at the front of an army or group of ships moving into battle, or the soldiers who are in this position
a substance used to give a special taste to ice cream, cakes etc, made from the beans of a tropical plant
having the taste of vanilla
Sense.EXAMPLE: vanilla ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香草冰激凌

Sense.DEF: plain, ordinary, or uninteresting
Sense.TRAN: 寻常的﹐无特色的﹐乏味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no plans for an inexpensive vanilla version of the software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有计划要生产该软件的廉价普通版本。

Sense.DEF: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指莫名其妙地〕突然不见﹐消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里﹐现在却不翼而飞了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: vanish without (a) trace/vanish off the face of the earth
GramExa.GLOSS: disappear so that no sign remains
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The youngster vanished without a trace one day and has never been found.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一天﹐那个年轻人消失得无影无踪﹐再也找不到了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird vanished from sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop existing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By the 1930s, the wolf had vanished from the American West.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到20世纪30年代﹐狼已经在美国西部绝迹了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Public support for the Prime Minister has now vanished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众现在已不支持首相。

Sense.DEF: extremely small or unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chances of dying under anaesthetic are vanishingly small.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因麻醉死亡的概率是极小的。

Sense.DEF: the point in the distance, especially on a picture, where parallel lines seem to meet
Sense.TRAN: 灭点﹐消失点〔尤指透视画中平行线的汇聚点〕

Sense.DEF: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

Sense.DEF: a dressing table
the lack of importance of something compared to other things that are much more important
Sense.TRAN: 某事物〔相比于其他事物〕的微不足道

Sense.DEF: a small bag used by a woman for carrying make-up etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性放置化妆品等的〕小梳妆盒﹐化妆包

Sense.DEF: a car number plate that has a combination of numbers or letters chosen by the owner, so that they spell a word that is connected with or describes the owner
Sense.TRAN: 特别车牌﹐自选车牌﹐个性化车牌〔由车主选定数字或字母组合的车牌〕

Sense.DEF: a company that writers pay to print their books
Sense.TRAN: 自费出版社〔指由作者自己出资刊印书籍的出版社〕

Sense.DEF: a dressing table
to defeat someone or something completely
a good position from which you can see something
Sense.EXAMPLE: From my vantage point on the hill, I could see the whole procession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从山上的这个有利位置﹐我可以看到整个游行队伍。

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking about things that comes from your own particular situation or experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole dispute looked silly from my vantage point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看来﹐整场争论显得很荒唐。

Sense.DEF: lacking intelligence, interest, or imagination
Sense.TRAN: 缺少灵性的﹔乏味的﹔平庸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: vapid conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平淡乏味的对话

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of vapour
to change into a vapour, or to make something, especially a liquid, do this
a mass of very small drops of a liquid which float in the air, for example because the liquid has been heated
Sense.EXAMPLE: water vapour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水蒸气

Sense.DEF: the white line that is left in the sky by a plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机在高空飞行时产生的〕雾化尾迹﹐凝结尾迹﹐拉烟

Sense.DEF: likely to change often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计明天多云有雾﹐天气多变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates can be highly variable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率有时会大幅波动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These fish are highly variable in color and pattern.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鱼颜色和花纹各异。

Sense.DEF: sometimes good and sometimes bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quality of pork is often less variable than beef.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪肉质量往往比牛肉稳定。

Sense.DEF: able to be changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heater has variable temperature settings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加热器有多挡温度设定。

Sense.DEF: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are too many variables in the experiment to predict the result accurately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验中可变因素太多﹐难以准确预测结果。

Sense.DEF: a mathematical quantity which can represent several different amounts
if two people or things are at variance with each other, they do not agree or are very different
Sense.TRAN: (与某人/某事物)有分歧﹔(与某人/某事物)有冲突
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tradition and culture are often at variance with the needs of modern living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统和文化常常与现代生活的需要有冲突。

Sense.DEF: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量的〕差异﹐不一致﹐变化幅度
Sense.EXAMPLE: a price variance of 5%
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5%的价格差异

Sense.DEF: the official permission to do something different from what is normally allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The developer requested a variance to build a shopping center on the east side of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商要求获得特免﹐在城东建造一座购物中心。

Sense.DEF: something that is slightly different from the usual form of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This game is a variant of netball.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种运动是无挡板篮球的一种变化形式。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a variant on the typical Hollywood hero
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的好莱坞英雄的变身

Sense.DEF: a slightly different form of a word or phrase
Sense.EXAMPLE: spelling variants in British and American English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国英语和美国英语中的不同拼法

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a variant form of the word
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词的不同拼写形式

Sense.DEF: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔相似物体之间的〕差异﹔〔数量或形式的〕变化﹐变动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: White bread is really just a variation of French bread.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白面包其实只是法式长条面包的一种变化形式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: variations in the quality of the rugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小地毯质量的差异

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a great deal of variation among the responses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反应各不相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The study concluded that the variation between the CD players was very small.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查得出结论﹐认为那些激光唱机差别很小。

Sense.DEF: something that is done in a way that is different from the way it is usually done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

Sense.DEF: one of a set of short pieces of music, each based on the same simple tune
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bach’s Goldberg variations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴赫的《哥德堡变奏曲》

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which the veins in your leg become swollen and painful
consisting of or including many different kinds of things or people, especially in a way that seems interesting
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的﹐形形色色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a varied diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰富多样的饮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: The responsibilities of government are many, and they are varied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府有很多职责﹐而且各不相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good teacher is aware of the extremely varied needs of each student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好老师能了解每位学生的不同需求。

Sense.DEF: a variegated plant, leaf etc has different coloured marks on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: variegated grasses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂色的草

Sense.DEF: consisting of a lot of different types of things
a lot of things of the same type that are different from each other in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls come from a variety of different backgrounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些女孩出身背景各不相同。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If you are using a variety of before a plural noun, it is better to use a plural verb, although a singular verb is sometimes used.
F2NBox.TRAN: a variety of 之后如跟复数名词﹐则最好使用复数动词﹐但有时也会用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: A variety of techniques were used.

Sense.DEF: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

GramExa.GLOSS: make something more interesting
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Occasionally working from home adds variety to a job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔在家上班可以为工作增添一些趣味。

Sense.DEF: a type of thing, such as a plant or animal, that is different from others in the same group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

Sense.DEF: a particular type of person or thing – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或物的〕类型〔常为幽默用法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lon has no patience with anything of the child variety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朗对小孩子一概没有耐心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: variety is the spice of life
Sense.DEF: used to say that doing a lot of different things, meeting different people etc is what makes life interesting

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They hold debates on a wide variety of topics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们就各类议题进行辩论。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fruit is eaten by a huge variety of animals and birds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 以果实为食的鸟兽种类繁多。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a seemingly infinite variety of beers to choose from.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎有无数种啤酒可供选择。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A rich variety of plants grow here.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里生长着名目繁多的草木。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 种类多得令人眼花缭乱

Sense.DEF: a television or radio programme, or a performance that consists of many different shorter performances, especially musical and humorous ones
a shop that sells many different kinds of goods, often at low prices
glasses that help you to see things at many different distances
if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的﹐各种不同的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jacket is available in various colours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are various ways to answer your question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于种种原因﹐他决定辍学。

Sense.DEF: many different types of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reasons why teenage girls get pregnant are many and various.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女怀孕的原因多种多样﹐各不相同。

Sense.DEF: in many different ways

GramExa.PROPFORM: variously described as/known as/called etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the phenomena variously known as ‘mass culture’, ‘popular culture’, or the ‘public arts’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被冠以不同名称如“大众文化”﹑“通俗文化”或“大众艺术”的现象

Sense.EXAMPLE: His fortune has been variously estimated at between $1 and $2 billion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的财富有各种猜测﹐从10亿美元到20亿美元不等。

Sense.DEF: a clear liquid that is painted onto things, especially things made of wood, to protect them, or the hard shiny surface produced by this
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指刷在木制品上的〕清漆﹐罩光漆﹔光泽的表面

Sense.DEF: to cover something with varnish
the main team that represents a university, college, or school in a sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中的〕学校代表队﹐校队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the varsity football team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学足球队

Sense.DEF: a university, especially Oxford or Cambridge
Sense.TRAN: 大学〔尤指牛津大学或剑桥大学〕

Sense.DEF: a game of rugby between Oxford and Cambridge universities, played once a year at Twickenham in West London
Sense.TRAN: 〔牛津大学和剑桥大学之间一年一度的〕橄榄球对抗赛

Sense.DEF: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Test scores vary from school to school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测验成绩各校不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: flowers that vary in color and size
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩和大小各异的花朵

Sense.EXAMPLE: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹饪时间可能略有不同﹐因烤炉而异。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charges vary according to size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用因大小而异。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试过各种不同的节食方式﹐效果各不相同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tests of varying levels of difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难易程度不一的测验

Sense.DEF: if something varies, it changes depending on the situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you wear when you go out?’ ‘Well, it varies.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你出门的时候通常穿什么衣服？”“噢﹐得看情况。"

Sense.DEF: to change something to make it different
Sense.EXAMPLE: My doctor said I should vary my diet more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说我应该使日常饮食更加多样化。

Sense.DEF: relating to the tubes through which liquids flow in the bodies of animals or in plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: vascular disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脉管疾病

Sense.DEF: a container used to put flowers in or for decoration
a medical operation to cut the small tube through which a man’s sperm passes so that he is unable to produce children
a soft clear substance used on the skin for various medical and other purposes
a man in the Middle Ages who was given land to live on by a lord in return for promising to work or fight for him
Sense.TRAN: 〔中世纪领主下面的〕封臣﹐家臣〔对国君或领主效忠﹐作为回报获封土地〕

Sense.DEF: a country that is controlled by another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vassal state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附庸国

Sense.DEF: extremely large

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government will have to borrow vast amounts of money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府将不得不借用巨额资金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量难民涌过边境。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that something is true about almost all of a group of people or things

Sense.DEF: very much

Sense.EXAMPLE: vastly different opinions

Sense.DEF: a very large container for storing liquids in

Subsense.DEF: the large palace in Rome where the Pope head of the Roman Catholic Church lives and works

Sense.DEF: a room with thick walls and a strong door where money, jewels etc are kept to prevent them from being stolen or damaged

Sense.DEF: a room where people from the same family are buried, often under the floor of a church

Sense.DEF: a jump over something

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢劫犯跃过柜台﹐抢走了200美元现金。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly from a lower rank or level to a higher one

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天密歇根队从第四位一跃成为全国头号球队。

Sense.DEF: in the shape of or consisting of several arches joined together
arches in a roof or ceiling

Sense.DEF: the desire to achieve as much as possible

Sense.DEF: the quality of being exciting or sexually attractive

Sense.DEF: a human form of the serious brain disease bse
a machine you use to record television programmes or play videotapes
any disease that passes from one person to another during sex
a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕视觉显示终端﹐视频显示终端

Sense.DEF: a computer screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: VDU operators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视频显示器操控人员

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘have’

Sense.DEF: the meat of a calfa young cow

a video jockey
to change direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A tanker driver died when his lorry veered off the motorway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位油罐车司机在他的货车冲出高速公路时丧生。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机偏离了航线。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着这条小路走400米﹐然后向左转。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风向往北偏了。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项最新的提议似乎朝着民主党的理想这个方向偏移了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conversation veered back to politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 话题又回到了政治。

Sense.DEF: vegetables

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水果和蔬菜

Sense.DEF: to be very lazy and spend time doing very little

Sense.DEF: someone who does not eat any animal products at all, such as meat, fish, eggs, cheese, or milk

Sense.DEF: a flat round cake made with vegetables and beans that looks like a burger but that does not contain meat

Sense.DEF: a plant that is eaten raw or cooked, such as a cabbage, a carrot, or peas

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Vegetable is a countable noun, not an uncountable noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: vegetable是可数名词﹐ 而非不可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They grew their own vegetables (NOT 不说 their own vegetable).

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone who is alive but who cannot talk or move because their brain is damaged
relating to plants in general, rather than animals or things that are not living

Sense.DEF: the practice of not eating meat or fish
to live without doing much physical or mental activity and to feel bored as a result

Sense.DEF: plants in general

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱夫卡斯有葱郁茂盛的植被。

Sense.DEF: relating to plants, and particularly to the way they grow or make new plants

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone cannot think or move because their brain has been damaged
a vegetarian
a vegetable
Sense.EXAMPLE: fresh veggies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜蔬菜

Sense.DEF: veggie food is made using vegetables, nuts, beans etc rather than meat or fish

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 素菜宽面条配炸薯条

Sense.DEF: showing very strong feelings or opinions
Sense.TRAN: 感情强烈的﹔观点激烈的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite vehement opposition, the Act became law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管遭到强烈的反对﹐这项法案还是成为了法律。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her vehement protests, he pulled her inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管她强烈抗议﹐他还是把她拉了进去。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The vehemence of her answer surprised them both.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她情绪激动的回答让他们俩都吃了一惊。

Sense.DEF: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you locked your vehicle?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你锁车了吗？

Sense.DEF: something you use to express and spread your ideas, opinions etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔表达和传播思想﹑观点的〕媒介(物)﹔手段

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1936年奥运会被用作纳粹的宣传工具。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Eastern Eye’ is an important vehicle for Black British opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《东方视觉》是英国黑人发表观点的一个重要窗口。

Sense.DEF: a film, television programme etc that is made to gain public attention for one of the people in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the perfect vehicle for Fleming to make his triumphant return to the stage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是弗莱明借以成功重返舞台的完美之作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: MGM made the film as a star vehicle for Brando.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米高梅公司拍摄这部影片为的是捧红白兰度。

Sense.DEF: relating to vehicles

Sense.EXAMPLE: no vehicular access
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆禁入

Sense.DEF: a thin piece of material that women wear to cover their faces at formal occasions or for religious reasons

Sense.EXAMPLE: a bridal veil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘的面纱

Sense.DEF: the system in Islamic countries in which women must cover their hair and faces in public

Sense.DEF: to avoid talking about something that happened in the past because it is unpleasant or embarrassing

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这整件事最好是避而不谈。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮躲在薄薄的云层后面。

Sense.DEF: to become a nun
if something is veiled in mystery etc, people do not know the truth about it so it seems strange or mysterious

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的讲话被看作是对寻求政治庇护者的含蓄攻击。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我很佩服。”格雷格说道﹐语气里带着几乎不加掩饰的嘲讽。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾斯珀一直沉默着﹐眼神让人捉摸不透。

Sense.DEF: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们接吻时她觉得热血沸腾。

Sense.DEF: one of the thin lines on a leaf or on an insect’s wing
one of the thin lines on a piece of cheese or some types of stone
a thin layer of a valuable metal or mineral which is contained in rock

GramExa.EXAMPLE: veins of gold
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金矿脉

Sense.DEF: a type of cloth that is similar to velvet but cheaper

Sense.DEF: to sell something

Sense.DEF: to honour or respect someone or something because they are old, holy, or connected with the past

Sense.DEF: a type of window covering made of long flat bars of plastic, wood, or metal that are fastened together and can be moved to change the amount of light that comes through the window

Sense.EXAMPLE: a desire for vengeance

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复仇的誓言
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of vengeance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复仇的行为

Sense.DEF: with great force or more effort than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The music started up again with a vengeance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐再度响起﹐更加激昂。

Sense.DEF: very eager to punish someone who has done something bad
Sense.TRAN: 有复仇心理的﹔图谋报复的﹐复仇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vengeful god
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复仇之神

Sense.DEF: a venial fault, mistake etc is not very serious and can be forgiven
Sense.EXAMPLE: a venial sin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可赦之罪

Sense.DEF: the meat of a deer
a picture showing the relationship between several things by using circles that partly cover each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔用部分重叠的圆表示若干事物之间关系的〕维恩图﹐文氏图

Sense.DEF: great anger or hatred
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was real venom in her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音非常凶狠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of pure venom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶毒的表情

Sense.DEF: a liquid poison that some snakes, insects etc produce when they bite or sting you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The viper paralyses its prey by injecting it with venom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蝰蛇通过注入毒液使猎物麻痹。

Sense.DEF: full of hatred or anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lisa shot him a venomous glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨恶狠狠地瞪了他一眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reid reserved his most venomous attack for the Rail Authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里德攻击铁路当局还有最厉害的一招没使出来。

Sense.DEF: a venomous snake, insect etc produces poison
Sense.TRAN: 〔蛇﹑昆虫等〕有毒的﹐分泌毒液的

Sense.DEF: relating to the veinstubes that carry blood in your body
a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
Sense.TRAN: 〔供气体或液体流通的〕孔口﹔通风孔﹔排气道
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blocked air vent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堵塞的通风口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a volcanic vent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火山口

Sense.DEF: to do something violent or harmful to express feelings of anger, hatred etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children give vent to their anger in various ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童用各种方法发泄怒气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew that if he gave full vent to his feelings, it would upset Joanna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道﹐要是他把自己的情绪全部发泄出来﹐就会把乔安娜惹火的。

Sense.DEF: a thin straight opening at the bottom of the back or side of a jacket or coat
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服后面的或侧边的〕开衩﹐衩

Sense.DEF: the small hole through which small animals, birds, fish, etc pass waste matter out of their bodies
to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he’s had a bad day, Paul vents his anger on the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是哪天过得不顺心﹐保罗就会在家人身上出气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could hear mum venting her frustration by banging the pots noisily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见妈妈在大声摔锅砸盆﹐发泄怨气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting gave us a chance to vent our spleen anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议给了我们一次泄愤的机会。

Sense.DEF: to let fresh air into a room, building etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a well-ventilated kitchen
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通风良好的厨房

Sense.DEF: to pump air into and out of someone’s lungs, using a special machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both patients are sedated and ventilated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位病人都用了镇静剂和呼吸机。

Sense.DEF: to express your opinions or feelings about something
Sense.TRAN: 发表〔意见或看法〕﹔表达〔感情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The important thing is to ventilate your anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要的是要把你的愤怒表达出来。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that puts fresh air into a room, building etc
Sense.TRAN: 通风装置﹔排气风扇﹐送风机

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that pumps air into and out of someone’s lungs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was put on a ventilator but died two hours later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上了呼吸机﹐不过两小时后还是死亡了。

Sense.DEF: relating to the stomach area of an animal or fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: Its ventral fins are orange.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的腹鳍为橙色。

Sense.DEF: one of the two spaces in the bottom of your heart through which blood pumps out to your body
someone who entertains people by speaking without moving their lips and making it seem that the words are spoken by a model of a person called a dummy
Sense.TRAN: 腹语术表演者﹐口技表演者

Sense.DEF: a new business activity that involves taking risks
Sense.TRAN: 风险项目﹐风险投资﹔冒险事业

GramExa.GLOSS: when two companies do something together
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合营﹐合资

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere that could be dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天黑以后﹐他就会壮着胆子出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paused before venturing up the steps to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她犹豫了一下﹐大着胆子迈上台阶﹐走向门口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: children who lack the confidence to venture into libraries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏自信﹑不敢进图书馆的儿童

Sense.DEF: to say or do something in an uncertain way because you are afraid it is wrong or will seem stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re on holiday here?’ he ventured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在这里度假吗？”他试探地问道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ventured to ask him what he was writing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小心翼翼地问他在写些什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If we had more information, it would be easier to venture a firm opinion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们有更多资料﹐就更容易大胆提出确定的意见了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roy ventured a tentative smile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊拘谨地笑了一笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ventured that the experiment was not conclusive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我冒昧地认为试验的结果并不确定。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot achieve anything unless you take risks
to become involved in a new business activity
Sense.TRAN: 首次从事〔某项业务活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Banks are venturing into insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行开始涉足保险业。

Sense.DEF: to do or try something that involves risks
Sense.TRAN: 冒险做〔有风险或危险的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I might venture on a new recipe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我也许可以尝试一种新的做法。

Sense.DEF: money lent to someone so that they can start a new business
willing to take risks
a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place
Sense.TRAN: 举办地点﹐举行场所﹐会场

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 体育比赛场馆/会议地点/音乐会演出地点等

Sense.EXAMPLE: The first thing to do is book a venue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band will play perform at as many venues as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the venue for the latest round of talks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新一轮谈判的地点

Sense.DEF: the planetthat is second in order from the Sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: the high surface temperatures of Venus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金星表面的高温

Sense.DEF: the fact of being true or correct

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has anyone checked the veracity of these allegations?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人核实过这些说法的真实性吗？

Sense.DEF: an open area with a floor and a roof that is attached to the side of a house at ground level
Sense.TRAN: 〔和房屋侧面相连﹑有地板和屋顶的〕走廊﹐游廊

Sense.DEF: a word or group of words that describes an action, experience, or state, such as ‘come’, ‘see’, and ‘put on’
spoken rather than written
relating to words or using words
Sense.TRAN: 与言辞有关的﹐用言辞的﹔文字上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: verbal skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言技能
Sense.EXAMPLE: verbal abuse cruel words from other kids on the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上其他孩子的谩骂

Sense.DEF: relating to a verb
Sense.EXAMPLE: verbal nouns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动名词

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Her boss failed to stop the other workers from verbally abusing her.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的老板没能阻止其他员工对她的谩骂。

Sense.DEF: a word that has been formed from a verb, for example a gerund, infinitive, or participle
Sense.TRAN: 动词性单词﹔动词的非限定形式

Sense.DEF: relating to criticism, complaints, or an attack that you express in speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria was getting loads of verbal from her staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚饱受员工的责骂。

Sense.DEF: to express something in words
Sense.EXAMPLE: Urge your child to verbalize his feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励你的孩子用言语表达自己的情感。

Sense.DEF: repeating the actual words that were spoken or written
Sense.TRAN: 逐字的[地]﹐一字不差的[地]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a verbatim account of our conversation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我们谈话内容的逐字报道

Sense.EXAMPLE: Their stories were taped and transcribed verbatim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们讲的事被录了音﹐并一字不差地被记了下来。

Sense.DEF: speech or writing that has many unnecessary words in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话或写作的〕冗词﹐啰唆﹐赘语
Sense.EXAMPLE: meaningless verbiage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知所云的冗词

Sense.DEF: using or containing too many words
Sense.EXAMPLE: For once, his usually verbose wife was content to listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那个一贯唠叨的老婆难得一次愿意倾听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Legal writing is often unclear and verbose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律文书往往措辞含糊﹐行文冗长。

Sense.DEF: verdant land is thickly covered with fresh green plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: verdant fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葱茏的田野

Sense.DEF: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁决为“无罪”。

Sense.DEF: an official decision made by a person or group with authority
Sense.TRAN: 〔当权者作出的〕正式决定﹐裁决
Sense.EXAMPLE: The players anxiously awaited the verdict of the umpire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员焦急地等待裁判的裁决。

Sense.DEF: someone’s opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience’s final verdict was encouraging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众的最终意见令人鼓舞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your verdict on the movie?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这部电影有什么意见？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trade unionists were quick to give their verdict on the proposals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会会员对这些建议迅速提出了自己的看法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree on a decision
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The jury failed to reach a verdict.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团未能作出裁决。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially say what a verdict is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The inquest jury returned a verdict of ‘unlawful killing’.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 死因调查陪审团裁定为“非法杀害”。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think about what it should be
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The jury retired to consider their verdict.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团退庭商议裁决。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when the whole jury agrees
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The jury found him guilty by a unanimous verdict.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团一致裁定他有罪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when most of the jury agrees
stating that the facts about someone’s death are not known
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 死因未详的裁决﹐存疑裁决

Sense.DEF: a greenish-blue substance that sometimes appears on copper or brass
green grass, plants etc

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the verge of sth
Sense.DEF: to be at the point where something is about to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jess seemed on the verge of tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰斯似乎差点就要哭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an event which left her on the verge of a nervous breakdown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让她几乎精神崩溃的一件事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mountain gorillas are on the verge of extinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山地大猩猩濒临绝种。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be on the verge of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The show was on the verge of being canceled due to low ratings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为收视率太低﹐这档节目就要被取消了。

Sense.DEF: the edge of a road, path etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car skidded across the road and came to a stop on the grass verge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车滑过路面﹐在路缘草带上停了下来。

Sense.DEF: to be very close to a harmful or extreme state
Sense.TRAN: 接近﹐濒于〔有害或极端的境地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of Lewis’s activities verged on the illegal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯的许多活动近乎违法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of his ideas are verging on the dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的有些想法近乎危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His love of James Dean movies verged on fanaticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对詹姆斯·迪恩影片的喜爱近乎狂热。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to care for the inside of a church and help during services
to discover whether something is correct or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A computer program verifies that the system is working.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑程序可以核查系统是否在运行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: American forces will remain to verify compliance with the treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美军将继续驻留﹐核查条约是否得到遵守。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say check rather than verify.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常说 check﹐而不说 verify
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can I just check that I have spelt your name correctly?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就核对一下是否拼对了你的姓名，好吗？

Sense.DEF: to state that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

Sense.DEF: a word used to emphasize a statement
the quality of being true or real
Sense.EXAMPLE: questions about the verisimilitude of the document
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对这份文件的真实性提出的问题

Sense.DEF: a word used to emphasize a description of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is a veritable paradise for those who love walking and swimming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区对于喜欢散步和游泳的人来说简直就是天堂。

Sense.DEF: an important principle or fact that is always true
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eternal verities of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生命的永恒真理

Sense.DEF: a very bright red colour
small animals, birds, and insects that are harmful because they destroy crops, spoil food, and spread disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beds were filthy and full of vermin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些床铺肮脏不堪﹐而且爬满了虫子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foxes are considered vermin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸被认为是害兽。

Sense.DEF: unpleasant people who cause problems for society
Sense.TRAN: 危害社会的人﹐社会的害虫﹐害人虫

Sense.DEF: covered with insects that bite
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of verminous old cats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对身上生满虫的老猫

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink made from wine with herbs and spices
Sense.EXAMPLE: dry vermouth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干苦艾酒

Sense.DEF: a form of a language that ordinary people use, especially one that is not the official language
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指非官方语言的〕本国语﹐本地语﹐土话﹐方言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Galileo wrote in the vernacular to reach a larger audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了让更多读者看懂﹐伽利略用本国语言写作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He lapsed into the local vernacular language spoken in a particular area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说着说着就讲起了地方土话。

Sense.DEF: a style of building, music, art etc that is suitable for ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑﹑音乐﹑艺术等的〕民间风格

Sense.DEF: relating to the spring
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vernal equinox
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春分

Sense.DEF: a small hard infectious lump that grows on the bottom of your foot
someone who is versatile has many different skills
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very versatile performer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多才多艺的表演者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a more versatile workforce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术更全面的劳动力

Sense.DEF: having many different uses
Sense.TRAN: 有多种用途的﹐多功能的﹐万用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Hegley’s outstanding versatility as an all-round entertainer
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 海格力作为一名全能艺人非同一般的多才多艺

Sense.DEF: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s sing the last verse again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《创世记》第3章第13节

Sense.DEF: words arranged in the form of poetry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of comic verse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本滑稽诗集

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Written in verse, the play was set in the Middle Ages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个剧本用诗体形式创作﹐以中世纪为背景。

Sense.DEF: to know a lot about a subject, method etc
Sense.TRAN: 精通某事物﹐通晓某事物﹐对某事物造诣很深
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman well versed in the art of diplomacy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟谙外交手腕的女人

Sense.DEF: the particular pattern in which a poem is written
a copy of something that has been changed so that it is slightly different

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new version of the software
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件的新版本

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the original version of the text
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文本的原文

GramExa.GLOSS: presented in a different language or form
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 英语/德语/电子/电影等版本
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Japanese version of an English play
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部英国戏剧的日语版
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think I preferred the television version.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我更喜欢电视版。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the human version of mad cow disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疯牛病的人类变体

Sense.DEF: someone’s version of an event is their description of it, when this is different from the description given by another person
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人对于某件事不同于其他人的〕描述﹐说法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: according to the official version of events
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据官方对事件的说法

Sense.EXAMPLE: Could Donna’s version of what happened that night be correct?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜对那晚发生的事情的描述是否正确呢？

Sense.DEF: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一群体或某一时期〕[解释做]某事的方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Marxist version of economics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思主义对经济学的诠释

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

Sense.DEF: a page on the left-hand side of a book
used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case
Sense.EXAMPLE: the New York Knicks versus the LA Lakers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约尼克斯队对洛杉矶湖人队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Supreme Court decision in Roe vs. Wade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院关于罗诉韦德案的判决

Sense.DEF: used when comparing the advantages of two different things, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance minister must weigh up the benefits of a tax cut versus those of increased public spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政部长必须权衡是减税还是增加公共开支更有利。

Sense.DEF: one of the small hollow bones down the centre of your back
a living creature that has a backbone
the point where two lines meet to form an angle, especially the point of a triangle
Sense.TRAN: 〔两线相交成角时的〕交点﹔〔尤指三角形的〕顶点

Sense.DEF: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vertical line
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂直线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vertical axis of a graph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图的纵轴
Sense.EXAMPLE: vertical window blinds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂直百叶窗

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is very high or steep
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 垂直的悬崖/攀爬/坠落等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gorge lined with vertical cliffs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 峭壁林立的峡谷

Sense.DEF: having a structure in which there are top, middle, and bottom levels
Sense.EXAMPLE: Formal communication channels are usually vertical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式的沟通渠道一般都是纵向的。

Sense.DEF: the direction of something that is vertical
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tower leans about 15 degrees from the vertical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座塔倾斜了约15度。

Sense.DEF: when a company starts to do or make some of the things that used to be done or made by companies it did business with
Sense.TRAN: 纵向扩张﹐垂直扩张〔指公司开始经营过去由生意伙伴经营的业务〕

Sense.DEF: an Internet portal that limits its content and services so that they are attractive and interesting to one specific type of person
Sense.TRAN: 垂直门户网站〔指内容和服务限于某一领域的专业网站〕

Sense.DEF: so high that you feel sick and dizzy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vertiginous drop to the valley below
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到下面山谷令人眩晕的落差

Sense.DEF: a feeling of sickness and dizziness caused by looking down from a high place
Sense.TRAN: 〔因从高处俯视而产生的〕眩晕﹐头晕

Sense.DEF: a U-shaped ramp used in activities such as skateboarding and snowboarding to perform special movements such as jumping high into the air
Sense.TRAN: U形池〔滑板运动或滑雪运动中表演特技用的特殊坡道〕

Sense.DEF: energy, excitement, or great pleasure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cziffra played the Hungarian dances with great verve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇夫拉热情洋溢地演奏匈牙利舞曲。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an adjective, adverb, or phrase
Sense.TRAN: 很﹐非常〔用于强调形容词﹑副词或短语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It feels very cold today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天很冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fishing industry is very important to the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕鱼业对于该地区非常重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic’s moving very slowly this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上车流非常缓慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: problems that are very similar to mine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和我非常相似的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel a lot better – thank you very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉好多了﹐非常感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m very, very used for emphasis pleased you can come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能来我真是非常高兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very kind of you to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您来帮忙真是太好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My sister and I were married on the very same exactly the same day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和姐姐在同一天结婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We only use the very best ingredients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只用最好的配料。

Sense.DEF: not good etc at all
Sense.TRAN: 根本不好/不高兴/不远等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just not very good at spelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的拼写一点也不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden’s not very big, is it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园很小﹐是吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assistant wasn’t very helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个助手一点忙也帮不上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Was the talk interesting?’ ‘Not very only slightly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “讲座有意思吗？”“不是很有意思。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the fact that something belongs to one particular person and to no one else
Sense.TRAN: 完全属于某人自己的〔强调某物归某人所有〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was thrilled at the idea of having her very own toys to play with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到有完全属于自己的玩具可以玩﹐她非常兴奋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last, she had a home of her very own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于有了一个完全属于她自己的家。

Sense.DEF: used with adjectives to say that the quality something has is very noticeable or typical
Sense.TRAN: 显著地﹐典型地〔和形容词连用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a very male reaction, I thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想这是男人典型的反应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His films are always very French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电影总是很有法国特色。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize your agreement or approval
Sense.TRAN: 非常…〔用于加强赞同的语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you serious?’ ‘Very much so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是认真的吗？”“非常认真。

Sense.DEF: used to agree to something

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use very with adjectives that have ‘very’ as part of their meaning, for example ‘terrible’ very bad and ‘fascinating’ very interesting. Just use the adjective, or use absolutely to emphasize it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要将very和已包含“非常”之意的形容词连用﹐如terrible (非常糟糕的)和fascinating(非常有趣的) 。 这些形容词单独使用即可﹐或用absolutely来强调
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use very on its own with verbs and prepositional phrases. Use very much.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要将very单独与动词和介词短语连用﹐而要用very much
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He very much regrets what happened.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对发生的事情深感遗憾。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Their efforts were very much appreciated.
He was very much in demand as a lecturer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为演讲者﹐他很受欢迎。
F2NBox.EXPL: In more formal English, much can sometimes be used without ‘very’ before a past participle or a preposition.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在较为正式的英语中﹐much有时可单独用在过去分词或介词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The point has been much disputed.
China has been much in the news recently.

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking exactly about one particular thing or person
Sense.TRAN: 同一的﹐正是的﹐恰好的〔用以加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in this very room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是在这个房间里去世的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll start at the very beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要从头开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those were his very words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就是他的原话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better start doing some work this very minute now, not later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好现在就开始干点活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That might provoke a riot, the very thing he was trying to avoid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那可能会激起一场骚乱﹐而这正是他竭力想要避免的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The very fact that you are reading this book suggests you want to improve your fitness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在看这本书正说明了你想改善自己的健康状况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By its very nature, capitalism involves exploitation of the worker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义最根本的本质就是要剥削劳动者 。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His life’s work was being destroyed before his very eyes directly in front of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毕生的成果就在他的眼前被人糟蹋。

GramExa.GLOSS: just thinking about or suggesting something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The very thought of food made me feel ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到吃的东西我就恶心。

Sense.DEF: the evening service in some types of Christian church
a ship or large boat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fishing vessel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔船

Sense.DEF: a veinin your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a burst blood vessel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破裂的血管

Sense.DEF: a container for holding liquids
a piece of underwear without sleeves that you wear on the top half of your body
a piece of special clothing without sleeves that you wear over your clothes to protect your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bulletproof vest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防弹背心

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing without sleeves and with buttons down the front that you wear as part of a suit
a sweater without sleeves
to give someone the official right to do or own something
Sense.TRAN: 授予﹐赋予﹐给予〔某人权利〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copyright is vested in the author for 50 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著作权归作者所有﹐为期50年。

Sense.DEF: a strong reason for wanting something to happen because you will gain from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since he owns the strip of land, Cook has a vested interest in the project being approved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 库克拥有那块地﹐因此这个项目获批他是有既定好处的。

Sense.DEF: the groups of people who will gain from a plan, project, proposal etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal faces tough opposition from powerful vested interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项建议面临强大的既得利益集团的强烈反对。

Sense.DEF: vested rights, powers, property etc belong to you and cannot be removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shareholders have a vested right to 10% per annum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东享有每年10%分红的既定权利。

Sense.DEF: having full rights to own or have something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He only took the job to get vested in the pension fund.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受那份工作只是想有权享受养老金。

Sense.DEF: a space inside the front door of a public building
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共建筑物前门内的〕门厅﹐前厅

Sense.DEF: the space at each end of a railway carriage that connects it with the next carriage
Sense.TRAN: 〔连接火车前后车厢的〕通廊﹐连廊

Sense.DEF: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new law removed the last vestiges of royal power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法律废除了最后一点王权。

Sense.DEF: the smallest possible amount of a quality or feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s not a vestige of truth in the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事毫无真实性可言。

Sense.DEF: a vestigial part of the body has never developed completely or has almost disappeared
Sense.EXAMPLE: The legs of snakes are vestigial or absent altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇的腿已经退化或完全消失。

Sense.DEF: remaining as a sign that something existed after most of it has gone
Sense.EXAMPLE: his vestigial sense of pride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他残存的自尊心

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing worn by priests during church services
Sense.TRAN: 〔神职人员主持宗教仪式时穿的〕法衣﹐祭服

Sense.DEF: a small room in a church where a priest puts on his or her vestments and where holy plates, cups etc are kept
someone who is trained to give medical care and treatment to sick animals
a veteran1
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Vietnam vet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越战老兵

Sense.DEF: to check someone’s past activities, relationships etc in order to make sure that person is suitable for a particular job, especially an important one
Sense.TRAN: 审查〔某人过去的活动﹑亲属关系等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All candidates are carefully vetted by Central Office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有候选人都由总部仔细审查。

Sense.DEF: to check a report, speech etc care­fully to make sure it is acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The author vets every script for the new TV series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部新电视连续剧的每一个剧本﹐作者都要仔细过目。

Sense.DEF: a plant with small flowers, often used to feed farm animals
Sense.TRAN: 巢菜﹐野豌豆〔常用作饲料〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a veteran of the Second World War
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 二战老兵

Sense.EXAMPLE: a Vietnam veteran
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越战老兵

Sense.DEF: someone who has had a lot of experience of a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 老手﹐〔在某方面〕经验丰富的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a veteran of countless political campaigns
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历过无数次政治运动的一名老将

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the veteran leader of the socialist party
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党的资深领袖

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 资深记者/资深演员/经验丰富的守门员等

Sense.DEF: a car built before 1905
a holiday in the US on 11 November when people show special respect to people who fought in wars as soldiers, sailors etc
Sense.TRAN: 退伍军人节〔美国的假日﹐在11月11日﹐纪念参加过战争的军人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is trained to give medical care and treatment to sick animals
relating to the medical care and treatment of sick animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: veterinary medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兽医学

Sense.DEF: a vet11
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed
Sense.TRAN: 否决〔尤指他人或其他组织已赞同之事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: President Bush vetoed the bill on July 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什总统于7月6日否决了那项议案。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept a particular plan or suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 不同意﹐反对〔某个计划或建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny wanted to invite all her friends, but I quickly vetoed that idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮想邀请她所有的朋友﹐不过我立即对此表示反对。

Sense.DEF: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission

GramExa.EXAMPLE: de Gaulle’s veto on the British application to join the EEC
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴高乐对英国加入欧洲经济共同体申请的否决

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The head teacher has the right of veto over management-board decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长有权否决管理委员会的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Washington’s veto of the laborbill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿对劳工法案的否决

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto not accept his refusal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel annoyed or worried
when you feel worried or annoyed by something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Erika stamped her foot in vexation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃丽卡恼火地跺了跺脚。

Sense.DEF: something that worries or annoys you
making you feel annoyed or worried
Sense.TRAN: 令人恼火的﹔令人烦恼的

Sense.DEF: a complicated problem that has caused a lot of discussion and argument and is difficult to solve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vexed question of sexism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 棘手的性别歧视问题

Sense.DEF: annoyed or worried
if birds or planes fly in a V-formation, they form the shape of the letter V as they fly
Sense.TRAN: 〔鸟或飞机成群飞行时的〕V形队形﹐人字形队列

Sense.DEF: a standard of graphicspictures and letters on a computer screen that has many different colours and is of a high quality
radio waves that move very quickly and produce good sound quality
travelling through a place on the way to another place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We flew to Athens via Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经由巴黎飞往雅典。

Sense.DEF: using a particular person, machine etc to send something
Sense.TRAN: 通过〔某人﹑某机器等〕传送〔某物〕﹔借助于
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent a message to Kitty via her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通过姬蒂的妹妹给她捎了个口信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can access our homepage via the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以通过因特网进入我们的主页。

Sense.DEF: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑计划或方法〕切实可行的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee came forward with one viable solution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会提出了一个切实可行的解决方案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will a hotel here be financially viable?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里建一家酒店从资金上说可行吗？

Sense.DEF: able to continue to live or to develop into a living thing
Sense.TRAN: 能存活的﹔能生长发育的
Sense.EXAMPLE: viable seeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可存活的种子

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the long-term economic viability of the company
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司长期的经济可行性

Sense.DEF: a long high bridge, especially one with arches, that crosses a valley and has a road or railway on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔架于山谷上的公路或铁路〕高架桥

Sense.DEF: a drug that helps men to have an erection
Sense.TRAN: 万艾可﹐伟哥〔帮助男性勃起的一种药物〕

Sense.DEF: a very small bottle used for medicine, perfume etc
food
the good or bad feelings that a particular person, place, or situation seems to produce and that you react to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have good vibes about this contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这份合同感觉很好。

Sense.DEF: a vibraphone
full of activity or energy in a way that is exciting and attractive
Sense.TRAN: 令人兴奋的﹔充满活力的﹐精力充沛的﹐活跃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong is a vibrant, fascinating city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港是座富有活力的迷人城市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sixteen, young and vibrant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她16岁﹐年轻又充满活力。

Sense.DEF: a vibrant colour is bright and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painting full of vibrant reds and blues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满是鲜亮的红色和蓝色的画作

Sense.DEF: an electronic musical instrument that consists of metal bars that you hit with special sticks to produce a sound
if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气流通过我们的声带﹐使之产生振动。

Sense.DEF: a continuous slight shaking movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vibrations from the earthquake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震引起的震动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The microscope must be free from vibration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显微镜一定要避免震动。

Sense.DEF: a way of singing or playing a musical note so that it goes up and down very slightly in pitch
Sense.TRAN: 〔演唱或演奏的〕颤动效果﹐颤音﹔颤吟﹔揉弦

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment that produces a small shaking movement, used especially in massage or to get sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指按摩或获取性快感时用的〕振动器﹐振动按摩器

Sense.DEF: a priest in the Church of England who is in charge of a church in a particular area
a house where a vicar lives
experienced by watching or reading about someone else doing something, rather than by doing it yourself
Sense.TRAN: 间接体验他人感受的﹔产生同感[共鸣]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vicarious pleasure that parents get from their children’s success
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母对子女成功感同身受的快乐

Sense.DEF: criminal activities that involve sex or drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fight against vice on the streets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打击街头犯罪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have smashed a vice ring a group of criminals involved in vice in Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方捣毁了芝加哥的一个犯罪团伙。

Sense.DEF: a bad habit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is my only vice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是我唯一的恶习。

Sense.DEF: a bad or immoral quality in a person, or bad or immoral behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 邪恶﹔劣根性﹔恶行﹐不道德行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jealousy is a vice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妒忌是一种恶行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: to reward virtue and punish vice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赏善罚恶

Sense.DEF: a tool that holds an object very firmly so that you can work on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He held my arm like a vice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手像老虎钳似的紧紧抓住我的胳膊。

Sense.DEF: the person next in rank below someone in authority, who can represent them or act instead of them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vice-captain of the cricket team
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 板球队的副队长

Sense.EXAMPLE: Vice-Chairman Derek Edwards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 副主席德里克·爱德华兹

Sense.DEF: a high rank in the British or US navy, or someone who has this rank
someone who is the head of a British university, and responsible for the way it is organized
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学中主持日常工作的〕校长

Sense.DEF: someone who is responsible for a particular part of some universities in the US
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vice-chancellor for student affairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责学生事务的大学副校长

Sense.DEF: a very firm hold or a very strong pain
Sense.TRAN: 像老虎钳一般的紧握﹐抓牢
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed my neck in a vise-like grip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手像老虎钳一般紧紧掐住我的脖子。

Sense.DEF: the person who is next in rank to the president of a country and who is respon­sible for the president’s duties if he or she is unable to do them
someone who is responsible for a particular part of a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: our vice-president for marketing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们主管营销的副总裁

Sense.DEF: a man who was sent by a king or queen in the past to rule another country
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时由国王或女王委派管理另一国家的〕总督

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the viceroy of India
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度总督

Sense.DEF: used to say that the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true
Sense.TRAN: 反过来也是如此﹐反之亦然
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys may refuse to play with the girls, and vice versa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩可能拒绝和女孩玩耍﹐反之亦然。

Sense.DEF: in the area around a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stolen car was found in the vicinity of the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被盗汽车在车站附近被发现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There used to be a mill in the vicinity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近曾有一座磨坊。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the vicinity of £3 million/$1,500/2 billion years etc
Sense.DEF: close to a particular amount or measurement
Sense.TRAN: 大约300万英镑/1,500美元/20亿年等
Sense.EXAMPLE: All meteorites are of the same age, somewhere in the vicinity of 4.5 billion years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有陨石年代都差不多﹐大概都是45亿年左右。

Sense.DEF: violent and cruel in a way that hurts someone physically
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious murder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一桩凶残的谋杀案
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious killer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶狠的杀手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep away from that dog, he can be vicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离那只狗远点﹐它有时很凶猛。

Sense.DEF: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly strong or severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious gust of wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵很猛烈的风
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious headache
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧烈的头痛

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凶狠地反拧她的胳膊。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which one problem causes another problem, that then causes the first problem again, so that the whole process continues to be repeated
the continuous changes and problems that affect a situation or someone’s life
Sense.TRAN: 〔逐渐影响某种局面或个人生活的〕改变﹐变迁﹔兴衰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vicissitudes of married life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻生活的波折

Sense.DEF: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered
Sense.TRAN: 〔袭击事件﹑抢劫事件或凶杀案的〕受害者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害人头部受伤﹐一周后死亡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most homicide victims are under 30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数凶杀案的受害者不足30岁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: victims of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪活动的受害者

Sense.EXAMPLE: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

Sense.DEF: someone who suffers because of something bad that happens or because of an illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔恶劣情况的〕受害者﹔〔疾病的〕患者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: victims of age discrimination
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年龄歧视的受害者

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the victim of an administrative error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是行政疏失的受害人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a massive aid programme for the famine victims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对饥荒灾民的大规模援助计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: AIDS victims and other patients who are terminally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾滋病患者和其他患不治之症的病人
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these people are innocent victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些人都是无辜受害者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was used to being in charge, not being the victim of circumstance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他习惯于掌控一切﹐而不是受制于环境。
