Sense.EXAMPLE: Saying that the unemployed ‘don’t want to work’ is a classic case of blaming the victim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说失业者“不想工作”是典型的归咎于受害人的做法。

Subsense.DEF: to be attacked, killed etc by someone, or to get a particular illness, especially one that kills
Subsense.TRAN: 被某人加害﹔罹患某疾病﹔成为某事物的牺牲品
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One theory is that the hostages fell victim to bandits.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种说法是人质落到了土匪手里。

Subsense.DEF: to be badly affected or destroyed by a situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many small businesses have fallen victim to the recession.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小企业成为经济衰退的受害者。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/become a victim of its own success
Sense.DEF: to be badly affected by some unexpected results of being very successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are now so many tourists that the area has become a victim of its own success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在来了这么多游客﹐使该地区因成功而反受其害。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that is killed and offered as a sacrificegift to a god
someone who always wears the most fashionable clothes even if they do not look good in them
Sense.TRAN: 时尚牺牲品〔指不管是否适合自己总是身着最时髦服装的人〕

Sense.DEF: the state of suffering because someone has treated you very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had therapy to help her overcome her sense of victimhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接受了治疗来帮助自己克服受害感。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone unfairly because you do not like them, their beliefs, or the race they belong to
Sense.TRAN: 〔因厌恶某人的信仰或所属的人种而〕不公正地对待﹐使受害﹐迫害
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men claim they have been victimized because of their political activity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人声称他们因为自己的政治活动而受到了迫害。

Sense.DEF: the winner of a battle, game, competition etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔战斗﹑比赛等中的〕得胜者﹐胜利者
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the game the victors returned in triumph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛结束后﹐得胜者凯旋。

Sense.DEF: relating to or coming from the period from 1837 – 1901 when Victoria was Queen of England
Sense.TRAN: 英国维多利亚(女王)时代的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big Victorian house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢维多利亚时代的大房子

Sense.DEF: morally strict in a way that was typical in the time of Queen Victoria
Sense.TRAN: 〔道德标准〕维多利亚(女王)时代特有的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victorian values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代的价值观

Sense.DEF: an English person living in the period when Queen Victoria ruled
Sense.TRAN: 维多利亚(女王)时代的英国人

Sense.DEF: objects made during the Victorian period
having won a victory, or ending in a victory
Sense.EXAMPLE: the victorious team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得胜的球队
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were confident that the Allies would emerge victorious finally win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确信盟军最终一定能获胜。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Raiders’ 35 – 17 victory over St Louis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击者队对圣路易斯队35比17的胜利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court’s decision represents a victory for all women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭的判决代表了所有女性的胜利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He said the court’s decision was a great victory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说法庭的判决是一个重大胜利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Arsenal expected an easy victory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳预计将轻取对手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The battle was a decisive victory for the US.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该战役对美国来说是决定性的胜利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a win by a very large amount in an election
a win by a small amount

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Today we have won an important victory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们取得了一个重大胜利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She led her team to victory in the finals.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带领自己的球队打赢了决赛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: finally win
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Adams scored a last-minute goal to clinch victory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当斯最后一刻进球﹐锁定胜局。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: win when it is difficult
win easily

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The victory celebrations went on all night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝捷活动持续了整整一夜。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a series of victories
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The team won a string of victories.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队连连取胜。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘get victory’ or 或 ‘get the victory’. Say 而要说 win a victory or 或 win victory.

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在战斗﹑比赛﹑选举或争端中的〕胜利﹐成功
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowds celebrated Italy’s victory against England.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们庆祝意大利队战胜英格兰队。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The party won a comfortable victory in the general election.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在大选中轻松获胜。

Exponent.DEF: a victory in a sports game or in a competition
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛或竞争中的〕胜利
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was an important win for the Yankees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是扬基队至关重要的一场胜利。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A couple from London are celebrating a big lottery win.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自伦敦的一对夫妇正在庆祝赢得彩票大奖。

Exponent.DEF: an important victory, especially in war or politics
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指战争中或政治方面的〕重要胜利
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thatcher’s greatest triumph was becoming the UK’s first female Prime Minister.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒切尔最大的胜利就是成为了英国的首位女首相。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which one country wins a war against another country and takes control of it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Spanish conquest of Mexico
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙对墨西哥的征服

Exponent.DEF: an election victory in which one party or candidate gets far more votes than their opponents
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1945, there was a Labour landslide.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1945年﹐工党取得了压倒性胜利。

Exponent.DEF: a very easy victory
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The match was expected to be a walkover for Brazil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计巴西队会轻取对手。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which the person, team, party etc that was expected to win is defeated
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Truman pulled off the greatest election upset in United States history.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鲁门的当选成就了美国历史上的最大冷门。

Sense.DEF: to supply a large number of people with food
food and drink
a large South American animal related to the llama, or the cloth that is made from its wool
Sense.TRAN: 小羊驼﹐骆马〔产于南美﹐与美洲驼近缘〕﹔小羊驼[骆马]绒织物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicuña coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骆马绒外套

Sense.DEF: a copy of a film or television programme, or a series of events, recorded on videotape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much does it cost to hire videos?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 租录像带要花多少钱？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s stay at home and watch a video.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们待在家里看录像吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rewind the video right to the beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把录像倒退到开头部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school will be making a video of the play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校将把这出戏拍摄成录像。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The movie has not yet been released on video.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影还没有录像带发行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: coming soon to a video store near you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像带商店即将有售

Sense.DEF: a plastic box containing special tape for recording programmes and films on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have we got a blank video one with nothing recorded on it yet anywhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们哪里还有空白的录像带吗？

Sense.DEF: a machine used to record television programmes or show videos

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you set the video to record the football match?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把录像机设定一下录下这场足球比赛吗？

Sense.DEF: the process of recording or showing television programmes, films, real events etc on videotape
Sense.TRAN: 录影﹐录像〔录制或播放电视节目﹑电影﹑真实事件等的过程〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course aims to help children learn through video.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一课程旨在通过录像帮助儿童进行学习。

Sense.DEF: a short film that is made to go with a particular piece of popular music
Sense.TRAN: 〔配在流行音乐上的〕录像短片

Sense.DEF: a digital recording of an event, for example one made using a mobile phone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a video clip shown on the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网上的一段视频

Sense.DEF: to record a television programme, film, or a real event on a video
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you video the movie at 8.00?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能录下8点钟的电影吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: A friend videoed the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位朋友拍摄了婚礼录像。

Sense.DEF: relating to or used in the process of recording and showing pictures on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: video production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像制作
Sense.EXAMPLE: video materials for language teaching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言教学的影像素材

Sense.DEF: a public place where there are a lot of video games that you play by putting money in the machines
Sense.TRAN: 电子游戏厅﹐电子游乐场

Sense.DEF: the activity of making a blog using video
a special camera that can be used to film events on a video
a circuit board that can be added to a computer so that it is able to show moving pictures
a video
a machine used to record television programmes or show videos
a system that makes it possible to have meetings with people in different parts of the world by sending pictures and sound electronically
Sense.TRAN: 电视会议系统﹐视频会议系统

Sense.DEF: a record on video of someone’s activities during a day, or over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group decided to make a video diary of the cycling trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个团队决定把他们的自行车旅行拍摄成视频日记。

Sense.DEF: a round flat piece of plastic that you use to record and show films or programmes in the same way as a video
a computer game in which you move images on a screen using electronic controls
someone who records events using a video camera
a vj
a video film that includes very violent and offensive scenes
a type of telephone that allows you to see the person you are talking to on a screen
a video cassette recorder
the activity of watching short videos on a computer, mobile phone etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在计算机﹑手机等上〕观看视频短片

Sense.DEF: a video

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a videotape of everyday life in Havana
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记录哈瓦那日常生活的录像带

Sense.DEF: to record a television programme, film, event etc on a video
a form of communication that allows information to be exchanged using a television system
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过电视传送的〕可视图文(系统)﹐视传(系统)

Sense.DEF: to compete very hard with someone in order to get something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon and Julian were vying for her attention all through dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭的时候﹐西蒙和朱利安从头到尾都在抢着向她献殷勤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are at least twenty restaurants vying with each other for custom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少有20家餐馆在互相争抢生意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the photographers vied to get the best pictures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的摄影师都争先恐后﹐想拍到最好的照片。

Sense.DEF: what you think or believe about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your view on the subject?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这个问题怎么看？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their view is that competition is good for business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为竞争对商业有利。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In my view, the country needs a change of government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐这个国家需要换个政府。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say I think ... rather than In my view ..., and What do you think? rather than What is your view?
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常说 I think ... 而不说 In my view ...﹐通常说 What do you think? 而不说What is your view?
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What do you think about her new boyfriend?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得她的新男友怎么样？

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking about or understanding something
Sense.TRAN: 思考[理解]的方式[方法]﹐考虑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum’s view of the situation was different to mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈对此情况的看法和我不同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a realistic view of human nature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人性的现实看法

Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional views of religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的宗教观点
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to have a clear view a definite idea of the kind of book you want to write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该对自己想写什么类型的书有一个明确的想法。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take a dim/poor view of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: disapprove
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took a pretty dim view of his behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他的行为颇有看法。

Sense.DEF: what you are able to see or whether you can see it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d like a room with a view of the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想要一间可以看到大海的房间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house has wonderful views over the valley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这幢房子能够极清晰地俯瞰山谷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suddenly the pyramids came into view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐金字塔映入眼帘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gun was hidden from view behind the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪藏在门后﹐看不见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fran hit him in full view of all the guests where they could see it clearly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰当着所有宾客的面打了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: During an eclipse, the moon blocks our view of the sun stop us from seeing it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日蚀的时候﹐月亮遮挡住了太阳。

Sense.DEF: the whole area that you can see from somewhere, especially when it is very beautiful or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: From the top you get a panoramic view of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从顶部你可以一览该市的全貌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A huge nuclear reactor now spoils the view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有个庞大的核反应堆破坏了景致。

Sense.DEF: a photograph or picture showing a beautiful or interesting place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book contains over fifty scenic views of Cambridge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中有五十多幅剑桥的风景照。

Sense.DEF: an occasion or time when it is possible for people to see something such as an art show

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A private view of the Summer Exhibition will be held.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季展览会将进行一次内部预展。

GramExa.GLOSS: being shown to the public
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The painting is currently on view at the Tate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画目前正在泰特美术馆展出。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the reason for a decision or action
Sense.EXAMPLE: In view of his conduct, the club has decided to suspend him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鉴于他的行为﹐俱乐部决定让他停赛。

Sense.DEF: because you are planning to do something in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bought the house with a view to retiring there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们买这房子是打算退休后在那里度晚年的。

Sense.DEF: having something in your mind as an aim

GramExa.PROPFORM: with this end/object/aim etc in view
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Defence was all-important, and castles were designed with this end in view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 防御最为重要﹐城堡的设计都考虑到了这一目的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What sort of job did you have in view?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你当时打算做什么样的工作？

Sense.DEF: to think about the effect that something will have in the future rather than what happens now

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have an opinion
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has very left-wing views.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点很左。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what you think about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a chance for you to express your views.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是你表达自己观点的机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree with it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This view is not shared by his colleagues.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个观点没有得到他同事们的赞同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: believe or help to prove that it is right
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are many people who would support his views.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多人会支持他的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His political views have not changed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政治观点没有改变。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My own personal view is that they’re being optimistic.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人以为他们持乐观看法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what most people think
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The general view was that he had done well.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 普遍认为他做得很好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has strong views on education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对教育有强烈的看法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: strong views that someone is unwilling to change
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 强烈坚持的/根深蒂固的观点
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is known for his strongly held views on modern art.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁都知道他对现代艺术的强烈看法。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Different people have different views about this subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的人对这一问题持有不同的观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: completely different
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are conflicting views about the best way to teach reading.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于教授阅读的最佳方法﹐存在互相矛盾的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a politician who has extreme views on immigration
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对移民问题持极端观点的政治人物

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were all of the same view.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都持相同观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have a particular view
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Government took the view that the law did not need to be changed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府认为该法律无需修改。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people say what they think, especially when they disagree

Sense.DEF: to think about something or someone in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law should be viewed as a way of meeting certain social goals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法规应被视为实现某些社会目标的一种途径。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s an issue that can be viewed from several perspectives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个可从多个角度来看待的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local people viewed newcomers with suspicion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人以戒备的心理来看待新来的人。

Sense.DEF: to look at something, especially because it is beautiful or you are interested in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mountain is best viewed from the north side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这山从北边看风景最美。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of tourists come to view the gardens every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有数以千计的游客前来观赏这些花园。

GramExa.GLOSS: go to see a house etc that you are interested in buying
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔因有兴趣购买〕看房/看公寓/看房产等

Sense.DEF: to watch a television programme, film etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

Sense.DEF: someone who watches television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new series has gone down well with viewers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新的电视系列片很受观众欢迎。

Sense.DEF: someone who looks at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the painting, the woman has her back to the viewer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画中的这名女子背对观看者。

Sense.DEF: a small box with a light in it used to look at slides colour photographs on special film
Sense.TRAN: 看片器〔里面有灯﹑用于看幻灯片的小箱子〕

Sense.DEF: the small square of glass on a camera that you look through to see exactly what you are photographing
a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

GramExa.PROPFORM: from sb’s viewpoint/from the viewpoint of sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try and think of it from the child’s viewpoint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The islands were important from the viewpoint of American security.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从美国国土安全的角度考虑﹐这些岛屿很重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Church’s viewpoint on divorce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会对离婚的看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From an ecological viewpoint, the motorway has been a disaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从生态角度看﹐这条公路是个灾难。

Sense.DEF: a place from which you can see something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Different viewpoints produce different images.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 角度不同﹐产生的画面也不同。

Sense.DEF: a period of time, especially during the night, when you stay awake in order to pray, remain with someone who is ill, or watch for danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在夜间为了祈祷﹑守护病人或提防危险情况的〕守夜﹐值夜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eva and Paul kept a constant vigil by their daughter’s hospital bedside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃和保罗一直在医院里守在女儿的病床边。

Sense.DEF: a silent political protest in which people wait outside a building, especially during the night

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 2,000 demonstrators held a candle-lit vigil outside the embassy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000名示威者在大使馆外举行了一次烛光静坐。

Sense.DEF: careful attention that you give to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need for increased police vigilance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方加强警戒的必要性

Sense.DEF: giving careful attention to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please remain vigilant at all times and report anything suspicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请时刻保持警惕﹐有可疑情况随时报告。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use the expression watch out rather than be vigilant.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常用 watch out﹐而不用 be vigilant
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We were told to watch out for anything suspicious.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被告知要警惕任何可疑情况 。

Sense.DEF: someone who illegally punishes criminals and tries to prevent crime, usually because they think the police are not doing this effectively
Sense.TRAN: 民间护法者﹐义务警察〔指因认为警方办事不力而私自非法惩治罪犯﹑试图防止犯罪的人〕

Sense.DEF: a short description in a book or play showing the typical features of a person or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或剧本中对人物或场景的〕简介

Sense.DEF: a small picture or design at the beginning or end of a book or chapter
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或章节开篇或结尾处的〕小装饰图案﹐花饰

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of vigour
using a lot of energy and strength or determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动﹐反对在该地区倾倒核废物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vigorous debate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场激烈的辩论
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

Sense.DEF: strong and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vigorous young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛的年轻男子

Sense.DEF: physical or mental energy and determination

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He began working with renewed vigour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以更加旺盛的精力开始工作。

Sense.DEF: a member of the group of Scandinavian people who sailed in ships to attack areas along the coasts of northern and western Europe from the 8th to 11th centuries
Sense.TRAN: 北欧海盗﹐维京人〔8到11世纪驾船劫掠北欧和西欧海岸的斯堪的纳维亚人〕

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: This coffee tastes really vile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这咖啡太难喝了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vile smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难闻的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a vile temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脾气太坏了。

Sense.DEF: evil or immoral
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vile act of betrayal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的背叛行为

Sense.DEF: to say or write bad things about someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Johnson was vilified in the press for refusing to resign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊因拒绝辞职而在报刊上遭到诋毁。

Sense.DEF: a house that you use or rent while you are on holiday
a big house in the country with a large garden
a house in a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victorian villas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚风格的房子

Sense.DEF: an ancient Roman house or farm with land surrounding it
Sense.TRAN: 〔四周土地环绕的古罗马〕庄园﹐宅邸

Sense.DEF: a very small town in the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little fishing village
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座小渔村

Sense.DEF: the people who live in a village
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole village came to the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全村的人都来参加会议。

Sense.DEF: an area of grass in the middle of an English village
someone in the past who had mental difficulties and lived in a small village with the other people there
someone who lives in a village
the main bad character in a film, play, or story
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧或小说中的〕主要反面人物﹐反派角色

Sense.DEF: the person or thing that has caused all the trouble in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 首犯﹐主要肇事者﹔为害的事物

Sense.DEF: a bad person or criminal
evil or criminal
evil or criminal behaviour
used in the names of places, especially in the US, to mean city or town
Sense.TRAN: 城﹐镇〔用于地名﹐尤其是美国地名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jacksonville, Florida
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达州﹐杰克逊镇

Sense.DEF: used humorously with adjectives or nouns followed by ‘s’ to show that a person, place, or thing has a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于形容词或名词加s之后﹐表示一种特性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her party was really dullsville.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的聚会无聊极了。

Sense.DEF: a poor farm worker in the Middle Ages who was given a small piece of land in return for working on the land of a rich lord
energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was full of vim and vigour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她精力旺盛。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper that you put on a salad
Sense.TRAN: 〔油﹑醋﹑盐﹑胡椒混合成的〕色拉调味汁

Sense.DEF: to prove that someone who was blamed for something is in fact not guilty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charges are false, and we are sure we will be vindicated in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指控不实﹐我们确信法庭会证明我们是无辜的。

Sense.DEF: to prove that someone or something is right or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision to advertise has been vindicated by the fact that sales have grown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售增长的事实证明做广告宣传的决定是正确的。

Sense.DEF: unreasonably cruel and unfair towards someone who has harmed you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bitter and vindictive old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满仇恨和报复心的老人

Sense.DEF: a plant that produces grapes
a plant with long thin stems that attach themselves to other plants, trees, buildings etc
a sour-tasting liquid made from malt or wine that is used to improve the taste of food or to preserve it
tasting of vinegar
a piece of land where grapevines are grown in order to produce wine
wine
vintage wine is good quality wine made in a particular year
Sense.TRAN: 〔某特定年份酿制的葡萄酒〕佳酿的﹐上等的﹐优质的

Sense.DEF: old, but high quality
Sense.TRAN: 旧式的﹐老式的〔但品质优良〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: vintage cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老爷车

Sense.DEF: showing all the best or most typical qualities of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vintage performance from Bruce Springsteen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场最具布鲁斯·斯普林斯汀风格的演出

Subsense.DEF: a year when a good quality wine was produced
Subsense.TRAN: 佳酿年份﹐美酒酿成的年份

Subsense.DEF: a year when something of very good quality was produced

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 2001 was not a vintage year for movies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2001年不是电影的旺年。

Sense.DEF: a particular year or place in which a wine is made, or the wine itself
Sense.TRAN: 〔葡萄酒的〕特定酿造年份[地区]﹔〔特定年份或地区〕酿制的酒

Sense.DEF: having happened or started not very long ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some classic songs on the album, but most are of more recent vintage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专辑中有几首经典的歌曲﹐不过大多数是近年的作品。

Sense.DEF: a car made between 1919 and 1930
someone who buys and sells wines
a type of strong plastic
records that are played on a record player – used especially when comparing them to cds
a wooden musical instrument that you play like a violin but that is larger and has a lower sound
a plant related to the violet
to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: regimes that violate human rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侵犯人权的政权

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes someone feel that they have been attacked or have suffered a great loss of respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victims of burglaries often feel personally violated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入室盗窃的受害人往往觉得自己受到了人身侵犯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media regularly violates people’s privacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体经常侵犯人们的隐私。

Sense.DEF: to break open a grave, or force your way into a holy place without showing any respect
Sense.TRAN: 〔强行〕打开〔坟墓〕﹔强行进入﹐亵渎〔圣地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vandals had violated the graveyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏者亵渎了墓园。

Sense.DEF: to force a woman to have sex
an action that breaks a law, agreement, principle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对法律﹑协议﹑原则等的〕违背﹐违反
Sense.EXAMPLE: human rights violations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反人权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a violation of international law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反国际法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops crossed the border in violation of the agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队违反协议﹐越过了边界。

Sense.DEF: an action that causes harm or damage by treating someone or their possessions without respect
behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically
Sense.TRAN: 〔指伤害他人身体的〕暴力行为﹐暴力
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: violence against women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对妇女的暴力

Sense.DEF: extreme force
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tremendous violence of a tornado
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙卷风极其强大的威力

Sense.DEF: to spoil something
Sense.TRAN: 破坏某事物﹐对某事物造成损害

Sense.DEF: an angry way of speaking or reacting
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke with a violence that surprised them both.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她言辞激烈﹐令他们俩都很惊讶。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were threatened with physical violence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到身体暴力的威胁。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: violence between a couple in their home
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police said she was a victim of domestic violence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称她是家庭暴力的受害者。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: between people of different racial/ethnic groups
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There were outbreaks of racial violence in some cities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些城市爆发了种族暴力事件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: violence that there is no reason for
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These films are full of gratuitous violence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些影片中充斥着无谓的暴力场面。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stupid and without any purpose

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were willing to resort to violence to achieve their ends.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为了达到目的﹐情愿诉诸暴力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suddenly starts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Violence erupted during the demonstration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威游行中突然发生暴力冲突。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes worse

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police warned that acts of violence would not be tolerated.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方警告称不会容忍暴力行为。

Sense.DEF: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the increase in violent crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪的增多
Sense.EXAMPLE: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突
Sense.EXAMPLE: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

Sense.DEF: someone who is violent is likely to attack, hurt, or kill other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was a violent and dangerous man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲脾气暴躁﹐是个危险人物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a reputation for turning violent suddenly attacking people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都知道他会突然动粗。

Sense.DEF: showing very strong angry emotions or opinions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had a violent quarrel and John stormed out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吵得很激烈﹐约翰气呼呼地冲了出去。

Sense.DEF: violent feelings are strong and very difficult to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took a violent dislike to each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩都十分厌恶对方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a violent temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脾气暴躁。

Sense.DEF: a physical feeling or reaction that is very painful or difficult to control
a film etc that contains a lot of violence
a storm etc that happens with a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的风暴/地震/爆炸等

Sense.DEF: extremely bright
Sense.TRAN: 极为明亮的﹐非常明艳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her cheeks turned a violent red colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸涨得通红。

Exponent.DEF: using force to hurt or kill people – used about people, crimes etc. Also used about films or books that contain a lot of violence.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人﹑罪行等〕暴力的﹔强暴的〔也用于充斥着暴力内容的电影或书籍〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a violent man who couldn’t control his temper
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个控制不住自己脾气的暴躁男子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the increase in violent crime
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪的增多
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film is too violent to be shown to children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片太暴力﹐不能给孩子看。

Exponent.DEF: violent and dangerous, and seeming to enjoy hurting people for no reason
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a vicious attack on an unarmed man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一个手无寸铁的男子的毒打
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We were surrounded by a gang of vicious thugs, armed with knives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被一伙持刀恶棍包围了。

Exponent.DEF: using force or violence, but not causing serious injury
Exponent.TRAN: 粗暴的〔但未造成严重伤害〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some of the boys were being a bit rough with the younger kids.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个男孩有点粗暴地对待比他们小的孩子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were complaints about rough treatment by the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人投诉称遭警方粗暴对待。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is very cruel and violent, and showing no pity
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Idi Amin was a brutal dictator.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊迪·阿明是一个残忍的独裁者。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a particularly brutal murder
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起特别凶残的谋杀

Exponent.DEF: attacking people in a particularly cruel way – used about people and fighting, especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人﹑争斗〕残暴的﹐残忍的〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a savage killer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶残的杀手
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was savage fighting in the capital Mogadishu.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首都摩加迪沙爆发了恶战。

Exponent.DEF: a bloody battle or war is very violent and a lot of people are killed or injured
Exponent.TRAN: 〔战斗或战争〕血腥的﹐伤亡惨重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bloody civil war
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤亡惨重的内战
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Russians were engaged in a bloody battle against the German army.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时俄国人正在和德军进行一场恶战。

Exponent.DEF: a ferocious attack or battle is extremely violent. Also used about animals that are likely to attack in a very violent way.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔攻击﹑战斗〕残酷的﹔〔兽类〕凶猛的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two armies fought a ferocious battle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两支军队打了一场硬仗。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a ferocious beast
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头凶猛的野兽

Exponent.DEF: a fierce animal or person looks frightening and likely to attack people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A fierce dog stood growling at the gate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条恶犬在大门口狂吠。

Exponent.DEF: a bloodthirsty person enjoys watching violence. A bloodthirsty story contains a lot of violent scenes.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人〕耽于暴力的﹔〔故事〕充满暴力的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In Mexico, humans were sacrificed to bloodthirsty gods.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在墨西哥﹐曾将人作为祭品﹐献给嗜血的神。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bloodthirsty tale of revenge
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个关于复仇的血腥故事

Exponent.DEF: showing or describing injuries, blood, death etc clearly and in detail
Exponent.TRAN: 渲染暴力和血腥杀戮的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gory horror movie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部血腥的恐怖片
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was too gory for many readers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于许多读者来说﹐这本书太血腥了。

Sense.DEF: with a lot of force in a way that is very difficult to control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was still trembling violently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍在剧烈地颤抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rushed to the bathroom, where he was violently sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冲到卫生间﹐猛吐了一番。

Sense.DEF: in a way that involves violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several people have been violently attacked in the subway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个人在地铁里受到了暴力袭击。

Sense.DEF: with a lot of energy or emotion, especially anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny protested violently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮强烈抗议。

Sense.DEF: a plant with small dark purple flowers, or sometimes white or yellow ones
a bluish-purple colour
a small wooden musical instrument that you hold under your chin and play by pulling a bowspecial stick across the strings
someone who plays the violin
Sense.TRAN: 小提琴手﹐小提琴演奏者﹐小提琴演奏家

Sense.DEF: a cello
someone who is very famous or powerful and is treated with special care and respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: They treated us like VIPs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把我们当贵宾招待。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were given VIP treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们受到了贵宾般的礼遇。

Sense.DEF: a small poisonous snake
someone who behaves in an unpleasant way and harms other people
an offensive word for an angry woman who often argues with people
relating to or caused by a virus
Sense.EXAMPLE: a viral infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病毒感染

Sense.DEF: passed on to other people on the Internet or using mobile phones
Sense.TRAN: 〔在网络上或用手机〕广为传播的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is one of the most viewed viral videos on the web.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是网络上被观看次数最多的“病毒视频”。

Sense.DEF: a viral video, advertisement etc
Sense.TRAN: 病毒视频﹐病毒广告〔在网络上广泛传播的视频﹑广告等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They use humorous virals to promote their products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们利用滑稽的“病毒视频”来推广产品。

Sense.DEF: a type of advertising used by Internet companies in which computer users pass on advertising messages or images through email, sometimes without realizing that they are doing this
Sense.TRAN: 病毒式营销﹐电子营销〔网络公司的一种营销方式﹐让计算机用户常在不知不觉中通过电子邮件传播其广告图文〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can reach more potential customers by using viral marketing techniques.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们可以利用病毒式营销技术让更多的潜在客户接收到信息。

Sense.DEF: someone who has never had sex
Mary, the mother of Jesus Christ
Sense.TRAN: 圣母马利亚﹐童贞女马利亚〔耶稣之母〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has never done a particular activity before
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snowboarding virgin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从未玩过单板滑雪的人

Sense.DEF: land etc that is still in its natural state and has not been used or changed by people
Sense.TRAN: 处女地/原始森林/未开垦地/初雪等

Sense.DEF: without sexual experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: a virgin bride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贞洁的新娘

Sense.DEF: something new that you are experiencing for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 新领域﹐处女地〔指初次尝试的新事物〕

Sense.DEF: the highest quality of olive oil, made from the first pressing of the olives
like a virgin
a small square musical instrument like a piano with no legs, popular in the 16th and 17th centuries
Sense.TRAN: 维金纳琴〔16和17世纪的一种方形小乐器﹐状如无腿钢琴〕

Sense.DEF: the birth of Jesus, which Christians believe was caused by God, not by sex between a man and a woman
Sense.TRAN: 童贞生子〔指基督徒所相信的耶稣是因神而生﹐而非男女结合而生〕

Sense.DEF: a garden plant that grows up walls and has large leaves that turn deep red in autumn
Sense.TRAN: 五叶地锦〔一种攀爬于墙上﹑秋天叶子会变成深红色的大叶园艺植物〕

Sense.DEF: the condition of never having had sex

GramExa.GLOSS: have sex for the first time

Sense.DEF: the sixth sign of the zodiac, represented by a young woman, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between August 24 and September 23
someone who was born between August 24 and September 23
Sense.TRAN: 属室女座的人〔即8月24日至9月23日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: having or showing tradition­ally male qualities such as strength, courage etc – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 有男子气概的﹐充满阳刚活力的〔含褒义〕

Sense.DEF: the typically male quality of being strong, brave, and full of energy – used to show approval
the ability of a man to have sex or make a woman pregnant
the scientific study of viruses or of the diseases caused by them
very nearly a particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 实际上的，实质上的；几乎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car ownership is a virtual necessity when you live in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在乡下﹐拥有汽车几乎是必需的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finding a cheap place to rent is a virtual impossibility in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要在这个地区租到便宜的房子几乎不可能。

Sense.DEF: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world
Sense.TRAN: 虚拟的﹐模拟的〔指通过计算机或网络〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: constructing virtual worlds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 构筑虚拟世界

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

Sense.DEF: on a computer, rather than in the real world
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professors can help students virtually by communicating over the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教授可通过网上交流的方式帮助学生。

Sense.DEF: space on a computer for storing instructions and programs until they are needed or being used
a situation in which a company’s workers do not go to an office to work, but instead use computers that are connected to the Internet to communicate with each other from different places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does the virtual office equal freedom or isolation?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚拟办公室意味着自由还是孤立？

Sense.DEF: an environment produced by a computer that looks and seems real to the person experiencing it
moral goodness of character and behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

Sense.DEF: a particular good quality in someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Among her many virtues are loyalty, courage, and truthfulness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有许多美德﹐诸如忠诚﹑勇敢和诚实。

Sense.DEF: an advantage that makes something better or more useful than something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Adam Smith believed in the virtues of free trade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当·斯密相信自由贸易的好处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilkins is now extolling praising very much the virtues of organic farming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

Sense.DEF: by means of, or as a result of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She became a British resident by virtue of her marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她借着婚姻成了英国公民。

Sense.DEF: to get an advantage from a situation that you cannot change, usually a bad one
Sense.TRAN: 利用某事物﹐将某事物化为优势〔常指无法改变的不利条件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a virtue of her acting limitations by joking about them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿表演上的不足自嘲﹐化不利为有利。

Sense.DEF: to get an advantage from doing something that you have to do, or to pretend that you are doing it willingly
Sense.TRAN: (假装)把必须要做的事情当作好事来做﹔不得已而力争有所得

Sense.DEF: a very high degree of skill in performing
Sense.TRAN: 〔表演方面的〕精湛技巧﹐高超技艺

Sense.DEF: someone who is a very skilful performer, especially in music
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指音乐上的〕艺术大师﹐大演奏家
Sense.EXAMPLE: violin virtuoso Vanessa Mae
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小提琴大师陈美

Sense.DEF: behaving in a very honest and moral way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a virtuous man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 品行端正的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue considered herself very virtuous because she neither drank nor smoked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休认为自己品行非常端正﹐因为她既不喝酒也不抽烟。

Sense.DEF: not willing to have sex, at least until you are married
Sense.TRAN: 贞洁的﹐婚前保持童贞的

Sense.DEF: a poison, disease etc that is virulent is very dangerous and affects people very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔毒物〕剧毒的﹔〔疾病〕迅速致命的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a particularly virulent form of influenza
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别凶猛的一种流感

Sense.DEF: full of hatred for something, or expressing this in a strong way – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 充满仇恨的﹐刻毒的﹐恶毒的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: virulent anti-Semitism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶毒的反犹太主义

Sense.DEF: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses
Sense.EXAMPLE: children infected with the Aids virus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童
Sense.EXAMPLE: a virus infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病毒感染

Sense.DEF: a set of instructions secretly put onto a computer or computer program, which can destroy information. When a computer that has a virus makes a connection with another computer, for example by email, the virus can make copies of itself and move to the other computer.
a program that sends a large number of annoying messages to many people’s mobile phones in an uncontrolled way
an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still in New York, trying to get a visa to visit Russia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍在纽约﹐正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She applied for a three month tourist visa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她申请了三个月的旅游签证。

Sense.DEF: a face
in relation to or in comparison with something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bargaining position of the UK vis-à-vis the rest of Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国相对于其他欧洲国家的谈判地位

Sense.DEF: the large organs inside your body, such as your heart, lungs, and stomach
visceral beliefs and attitudes are the result of strong feelings rather than careful thought
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑态度〕出自内心的﹐发自肺腑的﹔(未经认真思考而)出于感情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his visceral hatred of the ruling class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对统治阶级发自肺腑的仇恨

Sense.DEF: relating to the viscera
a British nobleman with a rank between that of an earl and a baron
the wife of a viscount, or a woman who has the rank of a viscount
a viscous liquid is thick and sticky and does not flow easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the liquid cools, it becomes viscous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这液体冷却后会变黏稠。

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of vice
the distance it is possible to see, especially when this is affected by weather conditions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指受天气状况影响时的〕能见度﹐能见距离
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visibility on the roads is down to 20 metres due to heavy fog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路能见度因浓雾降至20米。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The search for survivors was abandoned because of poor visibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于能见度低﹐放弃了对幸存者的搜寻。

Sense.DEF: the situation of being noticed by people in general

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exhibition helped increase the visibility of women artists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个展览帮助提高了女性艺术家的知名度。

Sense.DEF: the fact of being easy to see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high visibility clothing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高可视性服装

Sense.DEF: something that is visible can be seen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outline of the mountains was clearly visible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山的轮廓清晰可见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sign was clearly visible to passing motorists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一标志过路司机可清楚地看见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The comet is visible to the naked eye can be seen without using special equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

Sense.DEF: an effect that is visible is great enough to be noticed
Sense.TRAN: 〔影响〕明显的﹐显然的﹐可察觉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a visible change in his attitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度有明显的转变。

Sense.DEF: someone who is visible is in a situation in which a lot of people notice them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: highly visible politicians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分引人注目的政治家

Sense.DEF: in a way that is easy to see or notice
Sense.TRAN: 显然﹐明显地﹐显而易见地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was visibly shaken by the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那消息显然使她大为震惊。

Sense.DEF: the ability to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tears blurred her vision made it difficult for her to see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children who are born with poor vision
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天生视力不佳的儿童

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability to see perfectly
the ability to see when it is dark

Sense.DEF: the area that you can see
Sense.EXAMPLE: a figure at the edge of her vision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她眼角余光里的身影

GramExa.GLOSS: the area someone is able to see without turning their head
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As the cars overtake you, they are temporarily outside your field of vision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面汽车超车的时候﹐会暂时脱离你的视野范围。

Sense.DEF: an idea of what you think something should be like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a clear vision of how he hoped the company would develop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己希望公司如何发展有清晰的设想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President outlined his vision for the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统勾画了他对未来的设想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a grand vision for the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国家的宏伟构想

Sense.DEF: if you have visions of something happening, especially something bad, you imagine it happening
Sense.TRAN: 想象某事发生〔尤指不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had visions of the kids getting lost and getting abducted by some weirdo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想象孩子们走丢了﹐被什么怪人拐走了。

Sense.DEF: something that you seem to see as part of a powerful religious experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a vision in which Jesus appeared before her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她见到了耶稣现身自己面前的异象。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became a monk after seeing Saint Apollinaris in a vision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在异象中看见圣阿波利那里斯后﹐他便当了修道士。

Sense.DEF: the knowledge and imagination that are needed in planning for the future with a clear purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a leader with vision and strong principles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一位有远见﹑坚守原则的领导。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his enthu­siasm and breadth of vision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的热忱和远见卓识

Sense.DEF: someone who is very beautiful
the quality of a picture that you can see on a television
having clear ideas of what the world should be like in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under his visionary leadership, the city prospered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他富有远见的领导下﹐这座城市蓬勃发展。

Sense.DEF: existing only in someone’s mind and unlikely to ever exist in the real world
someone who has clear ideas and strong feelings about the way something should be in the future
a holy person who has visions
to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest
Sense.TRAN: 参观﹐游览﹔拜访﹐访问﹐看望
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric went to Seattle to visit his cousins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克到西雅图去看望他的表兄弟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was really pleased that they came to visit me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们来看我﹐我真是高兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which cities did you visit in Spain?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在西班牙去了哪些城市？
Sense.EXAMPLE: A recent trip to London gave me the opportunity to visit the Science Museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的一次伦敦之行让我有机会参观了科学博物馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t visit very often.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不常来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that they come/go to see someone, rather than visit them.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们经常说 come/go to see someone﹐而不说 visit
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He’s gone to Scotland to see his family.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去苏格兰探望家人了。

Sense.DEF: to go to a place as part of your official job, especially to examine it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building inspector is visiting the new housing project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑监察员正在视察这个新的住房项目。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President’s first trip abroad will be to visit with troops in Bosnia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统首次海外之行将视察驻扎在波斯尼亚的部队。

Sense.DEF: to go to see a doctor, lawyer etc in order to get treatment or advice
Sense.TRAN: 去〔医生﹑律师等〕处就诊[咨询]

Sense.DEF: to look at a website on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 访问﹐浏览〔因特网上的网站〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 1,000 people visit our site every week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每星期有一千多人访问我们的网站。

Sense.DEF: to talk socially with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you kids play outside while we visit with each other?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些孩子到外面去玩吧﹐让我们聊聊天。

Exponent.DEF: to go and spend time in a place, for interest or pleasure
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must visit Kyoto.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要去游览一下京都。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They visited all the usual places.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们该去的地方都去了。

Exponent.DEF: to visit a place. Go to is very commonly used in everyday English instead of visit.
Exponent.TRAN: 参观﹐游览〔在日常英语中﹐go to比visit常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you ever been to England?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去过英格兰吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They went to the Eiffel Tower and the Flea Market.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去了埃菲尔铁塔和跳蚤市场。

Exponent.DEF: to visit places of interest in a country
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We went sightseeing in the old part of the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去老城区观光了。

Exponent.DEF: to go and spend time with someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How often do you visit your grandparents?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你隔多久去看望祖父母？

Exponent.DEF: to visit someone informally in their home, especially when you live near them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔非正式〕看望〔尤指住在附近的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A few friends came round last night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个朋友昨天晚上来串门。

Exponent.DEF: to visit someone in their home, especially on your way to another place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kate said she’d drop by later to give you the forms.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特说她等会儿顺便过来﹐把表格给你。

Exponent.DEF: to visit someone who you do not see very often, when you are spending time in the area where they live
Exponent.TRAN: 〔偶尔来到某人居住地时〕拜访某人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Look me up if you’re ever in Newark.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是到纽瓦克就来看看我。

Sense.DEF: to do something to punish someone or show them that you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: God’s wrath will be visited on sinners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神的愤怒将降临于罪人。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone goes to spend time in a place or goes to see a person
Sense.TRAN: 游览﹔参观﹔拜访﹐访问﹐看望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a visit to Chicago
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥之行

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re just here on a short visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只在这儿作短暂逗留。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you come for a visit this summer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们何不今年夏天来这里做客呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to pay him a visit at his office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定去他的办公室拜访他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just had a visit from the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察刚来找过我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m only here for the weekend – just a flying visit this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里只过个周末这次逗留时间很短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his first official visit to Britain as Russian President
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选俄罗斯总统后的首次正式访问英国
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town is well worth a visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小镇绝对值得一看。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you see a doctor, lawyer etc for treatment or advice
an occasion when you talk socially with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barbara and I had a nice long visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芭芭拉和我作了一次愉快的长谈。

Sense.DEF: an official visit to a place or person
an occasion when a parent is allowed to spend time with the children after a divorce, or the right to do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔离婚父母对子女的〕探视﹐探视权
Sense.EXAMPLE: visitation rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 探视权

Sense.DEF: an occasion when God or a spirit is believed to appear to someone on earth
an event that is believed to be God’s punishment for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a visitation of plague
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天降瘟疫

Sense.DEF: a long visit from someone that you do not want to see – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的漫长拜访〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a small card with their name on it which people gave to someone they visited, in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去拜访某人时递上的〕名片

Sense.DEF: the times when you are allowed to visit people who are in a hospital
a university teacher who has come from another university to teach for a period of time
someone who comes to visit a place or a person
Sense.TRAN: 观光者﹐参观者﹔访问者﹐探望者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Times Square attracts more than 30 million visitors annually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时代广场每年吸引三千多万游客。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rina is a frequent visitor to the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里娜是这个城市的常客。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: visitors from overseas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海外来客

Sense.DEF: a book, especially in a church or hotel, in which visitors write their names and addresses
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指教堂或酒店的〕访客登记簿

Sense.DEF: the part of a helmetprotective hard hat that can be lowered to protect your face
Sense.TRAN: 〔头盔上可放下来保护脸部的〕面甲﹐脸盔﹐护面

Sense.DEF: the curved part of a cap that sticks out in front above your eyes
a flat object fixed above the front window inside a car that can be moved down to keep the sun out of your eyes
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车内挡风玻璃上方的〕遮阳板

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of plastic that you wear on your head so that it sticks out above your eyes and protects them from the sun
a view of a large area of beautiful scenery

GramExa.EXAMPLE: stunning vistas of the Norfolk coast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺福克海岸迷人的景色

Sense.DEF: the possibility of new experiences, ideas, events etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对新的经历﹑想法﹑事件等的〕展望﹐前景
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exchange programs open up new vistas for students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交流计划为学生展现了新的前景。

Sense.DEF: relating to seeing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tall tower adds to the visual impact of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的塔楼增强了这幢大楼的视觉效果。

Sense.DEF: something such as a picture or the part of a film, video etc that you can see, as opposed to the parts that you hear
Sense.TRAN: 视觉资料﹔〔电影﹑录像等的〕画面
Sense.EXAMPLE: the film’s stunning visuals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影令人震撼的画面

Sense.DEF: something such as a map, picture, or film that helps people understand, learn, or remember information
Sense.TRAN: 直观教具〔如地图﹑图片﹑电影等〕

Sense.DEF: art such as painting, sculpture etc that you look at, as opposed to literature or music
Sense.TRAN: 视觉艺术〔如绘画﹑雕塑等〕
〔计算机或文字处理器的〕视频显示器

Sense.DEF: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一边听他描述﹐一边想象那房子的样子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somehow I can’t visualize myself staying with this company for much longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐我想象不出自己还会在这家公司待很久。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to visualize how these tiles will look in our bathroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难想象这些瓷砖铺在我们浴室里会是什么样子。

Sense.DEF: in appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chairs should be visually attractive as well as comfortable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 椅子既要美观也要舒适。

Sense.DEF: unable to see normally – used especially when you want to be polite about this condition
in a way that involves the eyes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The process is easy to understand when it is demonstrated visually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用直观演示﹐这个过程就容易理解了。

Sense.DEF: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist
Sense.TRAN: 极其重要的﹐必不可少的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work she does is absolutely vital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所做的工作至关重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These measures are vital to national security.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施对国家安全极其重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise is vital for your health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼对健康非常重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is vital that you keep accurate records.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做好准确的记录极为重要。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is vital to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is vital to keep accurate records.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做好准确的记录非常重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is vital to be honest with your children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

Sense.DEF: full of energy in a way that is exciting and attractive
Sense.TRAN: 生气勃勃的﹐充满活力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rodgers and Hart’s music sounds as fresh and vital as the day it was written.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰斯与哈特的音乐现在听来还有刚写成时的那份清新和活力。

Sense.DEF: necessary in order to keep you alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: the body’s vital processes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机体的生命活动

GramExa.GLOSS: heart, lungs etc

Sense.DEF: the signs that show someone is alive, for example breathing and body temperature
Sense.TRAN: 生命体征〔如呼吸和体温等〕

Sense.DEF: great energy and eagerness to do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite her eighty years, Elsie was full of vitality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管已80岁了﹐埃尔茜依然充满活力。

Sense.DEF: the strength and ability of an organization, country etc to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: The process of restructuring has injected some much-needed vitality into the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重组为公司注入了一些迫切需要的活力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senator promised to restore the economic vitality of the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员承诺要恢复该地区的经济活力。

Sense.DEF: in a very important or necessary way
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sensible diet is vitally important if you want to remain in good health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如想保持健康﹐合理的饮食十分重要。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is necessary to keep you alive, for example your heart and lungs
the parts of your body that are necessary to keep you alive, for example your heart and lungs
figures giving information about the number of births, deaths, marriages etc within a population
Sense.TRAN: 生命统计﹐人口动态统计〔一国对出生﹑死亡﹑婚姻等人口资料的统计〕

Sense.DEF: a woman’s chest, waist, and hip measurements
Sense.TRAN: 妇女的三围(尺寸)〔指胸围﹑腰围和臀围〕

Sense.DEF: important facts about something, especially its size
a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to eat foods that are rich in vitamins and minerals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量吃富含维生素和矿物质的食物。

GramExa.GLOSS: a particular type of vitamin
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lack of vitamin E can cause skin diseases and tiredness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏维生素E可导致皮肤疾病和疲劳。

Sense.DEF: a pill containing vitamins
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps I ought to take vitamins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我应该吃些维生素。

Sense.DEF: to make something less effective or spoil it
Sense.TRAN: 削弱〔某物〕的效能﹔破坏﹐损害

Sense.DEF: the science or practice of growing grapes for making wine
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于酿酒的〕葡萄栽培(学)﹐葡萄栽培术

Sense.DEF: made of or looking like glass
if a substance vitrifies or is vitrified, it changes into glass
very cruel and angry remarks that are intended to hurt someone’s feelings
vitriolic language, writing etc is very cruel and angry towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: vitriolic remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻薄的言辞

Sense.DEF: angry and cruel criticism
full of angry and cruel criticism
Sense.EXAMPLE: vituperative comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谩骂性的评论

Sense.DEF: a spoken examination taken at the end of a university course
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学中一门课程结束时的〕口试

Sense.DEF: used to show that you approve of someone and want them to continue to exist or be successful
Sense.TRAN: 万岁！〔表示赞许或祝愿的欢呼声〕

Sense.DEF: music that is vivace is played quickly and with a lot of energy
someone, especially a woman, who is vivacious has a lot of energy and a happy attractive manner – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指女性〕活泼的﹐快活的﹐生气勃勃的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vivacious personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活泼外向的个性

Sense.DEF: a place indoors where animals are kept in conditions that are as similar as possible to their natural environment
Sense.TRAN: 〔模拟自然生态环境的〕动物饲养室

Sense.DEF: a viva1
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学中一门课程结束时的〕口试

Sense.DEF: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real
Sense.TRAN: 〔记忆﹑梦境﹑描述等〕生动的﹐逼真的﹐清晰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

Sense.DEF: an ability to imagine unlikely situations very clearly
vivid colours or patterns are very bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: his vivid blue eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他碧蓝的眼睛

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I can vividly remember the day we met.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我清楚地记得我们相遇的那一天。

Sense.DEF: the practice of doing medical or scientific tests on live animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔为做医学或科学实验而进行的〕动物活体解剖

Sense.DEF: a female fox
an offensive word for a woman who is bad-tempered or who fights
used before naming things that you have just referred to in a general way
Sense.EXAMPLE: three Greek cities viz Athens, Thessaloniki, and Patras
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三座希腊城市﹐即雅典﹑塞萨洛尼基和帕特雷

Sense.DEF: an important government official in some Islamic countries in the past
Sense.TRAN: 维齐尔〔旧时某些伊斯兰国家的高官﹑大臣〕

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces music videos on television
a website that has videos recorded by a particular person, that include their ideas and opinions
an opening for the neck in a piece of clothing, shaped like the letter V
Sense.EXAMPLE: a V-neck sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡心领毛线衫

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing with a V-neck
all the words that someone knows or uses
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个人学会或使用的〕词汇量﹐语汇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers were impressed by his vocabulary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的词汇量给老师们留下了深刻的印象。

Sense.DEF: all the words in a particular language
Sense.EXAMPLE: English has the largest vocabulary of any language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语在所有语言中词汇量最大。

Sense.DEF: the words that are typically used when talking about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most technical jobs use a specialized vocabulary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多技术性工作使用专业词汇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vocabulary of politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治词汇

Sense.DEF: the range of possible features, effects, actions etc, especially in a type of music or art
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种艺术形式所有可能的〕表达手段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charlie Parker expanded the vocabulary of jazz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理·帕克拓展了爵士乐的表达形式。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (the word) failure/guilt/compromise etc is not in sb’s vocabulary
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone never thinks of accepting failure etc
Sense.TRAN: 某人的词汇中没有失败/内疚/妥协等词语〔指从不接受失败﹑内疚﹑妥协等〕

Sense.DEF: a list of words with explanations of their meanings, especially in a book for learning a foreign language
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指外语教科书中有释义的〕词汇表

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has a very wide vocabulary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的词汇量很大。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had just started learning English and his vocabulary was fairly limited.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚开始学英语﹐词汇量很有限。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book teaches you the basic vocabulary that you need to know when you’re on holiday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书教你掌握度假时需要的基本词汇。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The instructions were full of technical vocabulary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份说明里尽是技术词汇。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the words they can use
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的主动词汇〔能够使用的词汇〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children of this age have an active vocabulary of about 1,000 words.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个年龄的孩子掌握大约1,000个主动词汇。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the words they can understand but do not use
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的被动词汇〔能够理解但不使用的词汇〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By eighteen months of age, the girl had a vocabulary of around 300 words.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个女孩18个月大的时候﹐已经掌握了300个左右的词汇。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Reading helps to expand your vocabulary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阅读有助于扩大词汇量。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way of learning new vocabulary?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习新的词汇什么方法最好？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The teacher gave us a vocabulary test.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师给我们做了一次词汇量测试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a word, especially in a coursebook or a language class
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指教科书或语言课上的〕词汇
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The difficult vocabulary items are explained at the bottom of the page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难词都在页面底端做了解释。

Sense.DEF: expressing strong opinions publicly, especially about things that you disagree with
Sense.TRAN: 激烈地表达意见的﹐敢于直言的﹐直言不讳的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Foley has been particularly vocal in his criticism of the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 福利批评政府时尤其直言不讳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a vocal opponent of the plan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是这个计划的强烈反对者。

Sense.DEF: relating to the voice or to singing
Sense.TRAN: 声音的﹐使用嗓音的﹔唱歌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: vocal music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a female vocal group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子歌唱组合

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The album features Jim Boquist on vocals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个专辑的歌曲由吉姆·伯奎斯特演唱。

Sense.DEF: thin pieces of muscle in your throat that produce sounds when you speak
someone who sings popular songs, especially with a band
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与乐队配合演唱流行歌曲的〕歌手

Sense.DEF: to make a sound or sounds with your voice

Subsense.DEF: the feeling that the purpose of your life is to do a particular type of work, especially because it allows you to help other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jan has a vocation for teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简对教书有一种使命感。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a strong sense of vocation
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的使命感
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You missed your vocation you would have been good at a particular job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你入错行了。

Subsense.DEF: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

Sense.DEF: a strong belief that you have been chosen by God to be a priest or a nun
Sense.TRAN: 神召﹔天职﹐〔宗教上的〕使命感

Sense.DEF: teaching or relating to the skills you need to do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: vocational qualifications
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业资格

Sense.DEF: a word or particular form of a word used to show that you are speaking or writing directly to someone
to shout loudly, especially when you are complaining
expressing your opinions loudly and strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔表述自己观点时〕大声的﹐激昂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vociferous opponent of the plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划的激烈反对者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minority population became more vociferous in its demands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数民族的呼声更高了。

Sense.DEF: a programme in the form of a video that can be downloaded from the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 视频播客〔可从因特网下载的视频〕

Sense.DEF: a strong clear alcoholic drink originally from Russia, or a glass of this
Sense.TRAN: 伏特加〔俄罗斯出产的烈酒〕﹔一杯伏特加

Sense.DEF: a popular and fashionable style, activity, method etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vogue for large families in the prewar years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战前岁月中大家庭的流行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Short skirts are very much in vogue just now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短裙时下非常流行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Suntanning first came into vogue in the mid-1930s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晒黑皮肤最早流行于20世纪30年代中期。

Sense.DEF: the sounds that you make when you speak, or the ability to make these sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: He recognized her voice instantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他立刻听出了她的声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear angry voices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到了愤怒的声音。

Subsense.DEF: the quality of sound you produce when you sing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sophie’s got a lovely singing voice.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲有一副悦耳的歌喉。

Subsense.DEF: a person singing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a piece written for six voices and piano
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为钢琴伴奏六重唱谱写的曲子

Subsense.DEF: the right or ability to express an opinion, to vote, or to influence decisions
Subsense.TRAN: 表达意见的权利﹐发言权
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Parents should have a voice in deciding how their children are educated.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在决定他们的孩子应接受怎样的教育时﹐家长应该也有发言权。

Subsense.DEF: an opinion or wish that is expressed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government needs to listen to the voice of middle-class Americans.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府应该听听美国中产阶级的呼声。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a fair, democratic society, in which individuals are able to make their voice heard express their opinion so that people notice it
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都能公开发表意见的一个公平﹑民主的社会
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Since the new program was introduced, there have been some dissenting voices people expressing disagreement.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从这个新方案出台以来﹐一直都有反对的声音。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Senator Prior spoke out, adding her voice to the call for new laws to protect the environment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普赖尔参议员公开发表意见﹐对要求立法保护环境的呼声给予支持。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people speak with one voice, they all express the same opinion
a person, organization, newspaper etc that expresses the opinions or wishes of a group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senator is the voice of the religious right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位参议员是宗教权利的代言人。

Sense.DEF: opinions or ideas that are reasonable, based on experience etc, or someone who has these ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben, as ever, has been the voice of reason throughout the whole crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本一如既往﹐在这场危机中始终代表着一种理性的声音。

Sense.DEF: to express your feelings or thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 表达对某物的感觉[想法]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Participants are encouraged to give voice to their personal hopes, fears and dreams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加者被鼓励要把自己的愿望﹑担忧以及梦想表达出来。

Sense.DEF: thoughts or feelings that you do not express but seem to warn, criticize, or advise you
Sense.EXAMPLE: My inner voice told me to be cautious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我内心有个声音告诉我要小心。

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb that shows whether the subject of a sentence does an action or has an action done to it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her voice was loud and clear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音响亮清晰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not loud
Collocate.EXAMPLE: When he spoke, his voice was soft and gentle.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话的声音轻柔温和。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: near the bottom of the range of sounds
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She heard the deep voice of her father downstairs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听见楼下传来父亲低沉的声音。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: near the top of the range of sounds
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They used to repeat her words in silly high voices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以前经常傻乎乎地尖声重复她说的话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Natalia’s clear voice rang out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳塔利娅清脆的声音响了起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quiet and not strong or confident
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She answered in a small voice, ‘I think I was afraid.’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小声回答:“我想我那时是害怕了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a voice that shakes because someone is very nervous or frightened
very high and not strong
low and slightly rough but in an attractive way
very deep and slightly rough
a voice that goes high and low in a pleasant musical way
speak more loudly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She did not raise her voice, or express any anger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有提高声音﹐也没有显出怒气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: speak more quietly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He lowered his voice to a whisper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他压低声音﹐悄悄地耳语。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not speak loudly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Keep your voice down, they’ll hear you!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小点声﹐他们能听见你说话！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lose the ability to speak, for example when you have a cold
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to whisper because I’ve lost my voice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能低声说话﹐因为我嗓子哑了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes louder or higher
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her voice rose in panic.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊慌地提高了声音。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes lower
becomes higher or unsteady because they are upset
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的声音〔因不安而〕变了

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes deep as he becomes a man
sounds unsteady
becomes quieter until you cannot hear it

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 用响亮/轻柔/低沉等的声音
Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Where is she?’ Kate demanded in a shrill voice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “她在哪儿？”凯特尖声问道。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His tone of voice was aggressive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气咄咄逼人。

Collocate.COLLOC: at the top of your voice
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a very loud voice
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She shouted ‘Help!’ at the top of her voice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扯着嗓子高喊“救命！”

Sense.DEF: to tell people your opinions or feelings about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: The senator voiced concern at how minorities and immigrants are treated in California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员对加利福尼亚少数族裔和外来移民所受的待遇表示担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She angrily voiced her objections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她愤怒地表示反对。

Sense.DEF: to produce a sound with a movement of the vocal cords as well as the breath
the part of your throat that you use to produce sounds when you speak
having a voice that is deep, very high etc
Sense.TRAN: 嗓音深沉/尖细/沙哑的等

Sense.DEF: voiced sounds are made using the vocal cords. For example, /d/ and /ɡ/ are voiced consonants.
unable to get your opinions or concerns noticed by people in power
Sense.TRAN: 不能表达观点的﹐无发言权的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The vast majority of our people feel ignored and voiceless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们人民中的绝大多数觉得受到了忽视﹐而且没有发言权。

Sense.DEF: voiceless sounds are made without using the vocal cords. For example, /p/ and /k/ are voiceless consonants.
a system which lets people leave recorded messages for you on your telephone when you are unable to answer it
a US radio station which broadcasts news and other programmes to other countries
Sense.TRAN: 美国之音〔美国一广播电台﹐对其他国家播送新闻等节目〕

Sense.DEF: information or remarks that are spoken on a television programme or film by someone who is not seen on the screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视节目﹑电影的〕画外音﹐解说

Sense.DEF: someone’s voice recorded on a machine, used to check who that person is
a feeling of great sadness that you have when someone you love dies or when something is taken from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Running the business helped to fill the void after his wife died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做生意填补了他自妻子死后产生的孤寂感。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something important or interesting is needed or wanted, but does not exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: The amusement park will fill a void in this town, which has little entertainment for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游乐场将填补这座小城儿童娱乐设施匮乏的空白。

Sense.DEF: an empty area of space where nothing exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked over the cliff into the void.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从悬崖边上望下去﹐下面一片茫茫。

Sense.DEF: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔合同或正式协议〕无效的﹐没有法律效力的

Sense.DEF: completely lacking something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were void of all expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼神一片茫然。

Sense.DEF: to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect
Sense.TRAN: 使〔契约或协议〕无效﹐使作废

Sense.DEF: used when you are showing or telling someone something surprising
Sense.TRAN: 瞧！〔用于把令人感到意外的事物展示给或告诉某人时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Voilà!’ she said, producing a pair of white shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “瞧！”她说着﹐拿出一双白色的鞋子。

Sense.DEF: a very light almost transparent cloth made of cotton, wool, or silk
Sense.TRAN: 巴里纱〔一种很轻﹑近乎透明的布料﹐用棉﹑毛或真丝织成〕

Sense.DEF: the technology that allows people to use broadband Internet connections to speak over the telephone. This is cheaper than using normal telephones.

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= volume 〔书的〕卷﹐册

Sense.DEF: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increasingly volatile political situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益动荡的政治局势
Sense.EXAMPLE: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

Sense.DEF: someone who is volatile can suddenly become angry or violent
Sense.TRAN: 易激动的﹔易发作的﹔易怒的

Sense.DEF: a volatile liquid or substance changes easily into a gas
a small round piece of pastry that is filled with chicken, vegetables etc and eaten at parties
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种以鸡肉﹑蔬菜等为馅的〕肉馅油酥饼

Sense.DEF: relating to or caused by a volcano
Sense.TRAN: 火山的﹔由火山作用引起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: black volcanic sand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑色的火山砂

PIC.HEADING: VOLCANO 火山
PIC.PICCONTENT: ash 火山灰；crater 火山口；lava 熔岩；magma 岩浆

Sense.DEF: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lavavery hot liquid rock is sometimes forced out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that may explode at any time
one that is not active at the moment
one that is no longer active at all

Sense.DEF: a small animal like a mouse with a short tail that lives in fields and woods and near rivers
if you do something of your own volition, you do it because you want to, not because you are forced to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helena left the company of her own volition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦娜是自愿离开公司的。

Sense.DEF: the power to choose or decide something without being forced to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was without her own volition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有自主选择权。

Sense.DEF: a large number of bullets, rocks etc shot or thrown through the air at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a volley of bullets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹齐射

Sense.DEF: a lot of questions, insults, attacks etc that are all said or made at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔质问﹑辱骂﹑攻击等的〕连发﹐迸发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a volley of abuse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串辱骂

Sense.DEF: a hit in tennis, a kick in football etc when the player hits or kicks the ball before it touches the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔在网球着地前的〕截击﹔〔在足球落地前的〕截踢﹐凌空球

Sense.DEF: to hit or kick a ball before it touches the ground, especially in tennis or football
Sense.TRAN: 截击(球)﹐截踢 (球)〔尤指网球或足球〕

Sense.DEF: if a large number of guns volley, they are all fired at the same time
a game in which two teams use their hands to hit a ball over a high net
a unit for measuring the force of an electric current
electrical force measured in volts
a change to a completely opposite opinion or plan of action
Sense.TRAN: 〔意见﹑行动计划等的〕完全改变﹐大转变﹐180度大转弯

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring voltage
talking a lot or talking quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clarissa was extremely voluble on the subject of good manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉丽莎谈起礼仪这个话题便口若悬河。

Sense.DEF: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the volume up?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把音量调大好吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say turn something up or turn something down rather than use the noun volume.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常说 turn something up 或 turn something down﹐而不用名词 volume
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the TV up a bit?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把电视机调响一点好吗？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She’s always yelling at us to turn our music down.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是叫嚷着要我们把音乐声调轻 。

Sense.DEF: the total amount of something, especially when it is large or increasing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指巨大的或正在增加的〕量﹐总量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The volume of traffic on the roads has increased dramatically in recent years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来道路交通量急剧增加。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the volume of trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易量

Sense.DEF: a measurement of the amount of space that a substance or object fills, or the amount of space in a container

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an instrument for measuring the volume of a gas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 测量气体体积的仪器

Sense.EXAMPLE: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

Subsense.DEF: a book that is part of a set, or one into which a very long book is divided
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

Subsense.DEF: a book

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a volume of Keats’s poetry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本济慈的诗集

Subsense.DEF: all the copies of a particular magazine printed in one particular year
Subsense.TRAN: 〔一本杂志全年的〕合集﹐合订本

Sense.DEF: a voluminous piece of clothing is very large and loose – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕宽大的﹐宽松的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voluminous cloak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽大的斗篷

Sense.DEF: voluminous books, documents etc are very long and contain a lot of detail
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑文件等〕篇幅长的﹐大部头的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took voluminous notes during the lecture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在听课时作了大量笔记。

Sense.DEF: a voluminous container is very large and can hold a lot of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voluminous suitcase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个能装很多东西的手提箱

Sense.DEF: if you do something voluntarily, you do it willingly, without anyone telling you to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t fired – she left voluntarily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不是被解雇的她是自愿离职的。

Sense.DEF: if you do work voluntarily, you do it because you want to, and are not paid for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan worked in the studios voluntarily, to gain experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊在工作室里义务工作﹐以获取经验。

Subsense.DEF: an organization etc that is organized or supported by people who give their money, services etc because they want to and who do not intend to make a profit
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a voluntary organization providing help for the elderly
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为老年人提供帮助的志愿组织
