Subsense.EXAMPLE: environmental work carried out by the voluntary sector
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由志愿部门开展的环境保护工作

Subsense.DEF: work etc that is done by people who do it because they want to, and who are not paid
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She does a lot of voluntary work for the Red Cross.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为红十字会做大量的志愿工作。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a drop-in centre for homeless people, run on a voluntary basis
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿组织开办的无家可归者援助中心

Sense.DEF: done willingly and without being forced
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

Sense.DEF: voluntary movements of your body are controlled by your conscious mind
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体活动〕自主的﹐随意的﹐自由的

Sense.DEF: a piece of music played in church, usually by the organ
someone who does a job willingly without being paid
Sense.TRAN: 志愿者﹐义务工作者﹐自愿参加者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

Sense.DEF: someone who is willing to offer help
Sense.TRAN: 主动提供帮助的人﹐自告奋勇者
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need some volunteers to help with the washing-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要几个自告奋勇者帮我洗餐具。

Sense.DEF: someone who joins the army, navy, or air force without being forced to
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do
Sense.TRAN: 自愿〔做某事〕﹔自告奋勇﹐自愿效劳

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen volunteered to have Thanksgiving at her house this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦主动提出今年的感恩节在她家过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sidcup volunteered for guard duty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西德卡普自告奋勇去站岗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I volunteered my services as a driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我主动提出来当司机。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something without being asked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael volunteered the information before I had a chance to ask.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没来得及问﹐迈克尔就主动提供了信息。

Sense.DEF: to offer to join the army, navy, or air force
Sense.EXAMPLE: When war broke out, my father volunteered immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争一爆发﹐我父亲立即志愿从军。

Sense.DEF: to say that someone else will do a job even though they may not want to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum volunteered Dave for washing-up duties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈替戴夫应下了洗碗的差使。

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys physical pleasure and having expensive possessions
Sense.TRAN: 耽于享乐的人﹐生活奢靡的人

Sense.DEF: a woman who is voluptuous has large breasts and a soft curved body
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕身材丰满性感的﹐妖娆的

Sense.DEF: expressing strong sexual feeling or sexual pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voluptuous gesture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑逗的举动

Sense.DEF: something that is voluptuous gives you pleasure because it looks, smells, or tastes good
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉悦的﹐给感官以快感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the voluptuous fragrance of a summer garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季花园中散发出的令人心旷神怡的芬芳

Sense.DEF: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth, because you are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had swallowed so much sea water he wanted to vomit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呛了这么多海水﹐所以想吐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew I was really in trouble when I began vomiting blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始吐血的时候才知道我的麻烦大了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I vomited up most of my dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃的饭大部分都吐掉了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone throws up, is sick, or in American English gets sick.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常说某人throw up﹐be sick﹐或在美国英语中说get sick
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把吃下去的饭都吐了 。

Sense.DEF: food or other substances that come up from your stomach and through your mouth when you vomit
magical beliefs and practices used as a form of religion, especially by people in Haiti
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指海地人信仰的〕伏都教(巫术)

Sense.DEF: economic ideas that seem attractive but that do not work effectively over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 巫毒经济学〔表面吸引人但在一段时期内并不带来成效的经济观点〕

Sense.DEF: eating or wanting large quantities of food
Sense.TRAN: 贪吃的﹔食量大的﹐胃口大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pigs are voracious feeders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪的食量很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids can have voracious appetites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子有时胃口很大。

Sense.DEF: having an extremely strong desire to do or have a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voracious reader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个如饥似渴的读者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her appetite for information was voracious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对信息有强烈的渴求。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮总是如饥似渴地阅读。

Sense.DEF: a mass of wind or water that spins quickly and pulls things into its centre
a situation that has a powerful effect on people’s lives and that influences their behaviour, even if they do not want it to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vortex of emotions surrounding the case
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 围绕这宗案件的感情旋涡

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly practises a particular religion
to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1918 British women got the right to vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1918年﹐英国妇女获得了选举权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I voted for the Labour candidate in the last election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在上次选举中投了工党候选人的票。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: 53% of Danes voted in favour of the Maastricht treaty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 53%的丹麦人投票赞成《马斯特里赫特条约》。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people of Ulster had finally been given a chance to vote on the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔斯特(即北爱尔兰)人民在这个问题上终于获得了一个投票的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress voted to increase foreign aid by 10%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会表决通过增加10%的对外援助。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shareholders voted to reject the offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东投票否决了这个提议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve voted Democrat all my life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经投了一辈子民主党的票。

Sense.LEXUNIT: vote sb into/out of power/office/parliament etc
Sense.DEF: to elect or dismiss someone by voting
Sense.TRAN: 投票把某人选上台/选下台/选进议会/使某人失去议会席位等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chances are that the government will be voted out of office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有可能政府会被选下台。

Sense.DEF: to choose someone or something for a particular prize by voting for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1981 Henry Fonda was voted Best Actor for ‘On Golden Pond’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1981年亨利·方达凭《金色池塘》当选最佳男演员。

Sense.DEF: if a parliament, committee etc votes a sum of money for something, they decide by voting to provide money for that particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔议会﹑委员会等通过投票〕同意提供〔款项〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parliament has voted £20 million extra funding for road improvements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会投票通过增拨2,000万英镑用于改善道路。

Sense.LEXUNIT: vote sth a success/the best etc
Sense.DEF: if people vote something a success etc, they all agree that it is a success
Sense.TRAN: 一致认为某事物是成功/最好的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening was voted a great success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都认为晚会办得很成功。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you prefer one particular choice or possible action

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I vote we go to the movies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议我们去看电影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you want to eat?’ ‘I vote for Mexican.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想吃什么？”“我想吃墨西哥菜。

Subsense.DEF: to vote for someone or something that you think will help you have the most money
Subsense.TRAN: 投票给能为自己带来最大经济利益的人[事物]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People generally vote with their pocketbooks against new taxes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们考虑到自己的钱包﹐通常都投票反对新税项。

Subsense.DEF: to show you like something by choosing to buy it
Subsense.TRAN: 用购买的方式表示喜欢某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Readers vote with their wallets every day when they choose a newspaper.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 读者每天在选择报纸时﹐就是在用钱包表达他们的喜好。

Sense.DEF: to show that you do not support a decision or action by leaving a place or organization
Sense.TRAN: 以退席[退出组织]表示不支持〔某决定﹑行动等〕

Exponent.DEF: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve voted Democrat all my life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经投了一辈子民主党的票。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can vote for your favourite singer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把票投给你最喜欢的歌手。

Exponent.DEF: to choose a leader, representative, or government by voting, so that they become the new leader, representative etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was elected mayor of London.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选伦敦市长。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the newly-elected government
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新当选的政府

Exponent.DEF: if a country or voters go to the polls, they vote in an election – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 参加投票〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The US goes to the polls in November.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国11月举行大选。

Exponent.DEF: if a group of people at a meeting take a vote, they vote about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We should take a vote on whether or not to accept their offer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该投票决定是否接受他们的报价。

Exponent.DEF: to mark a piece of paper, call a telephone number etc in order to vote
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The first votes have been cast in the country’s general election.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国大选已进行了第一轮投票。

Exponent.DEF: to ask the members of an organization to vote on something in order to decide what to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The union will ballot its members on whether to go ahead with the strike action.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会将要求其会员投票决定是否继续罢工行动。

Exponent.DEF: to vote against something that other people have agreed on, so that it cannot happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The president has the right to veto any piece of legislation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统有权否决任何立法。

Sense.DEF: to defeat a plan, law etc by voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1999 the town had voted down a petition to close the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1999年镇上投票否决了关闭这所学校的请求。

Sense.DEF: to elect someone by voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new chairman was voted in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票选出了一位新主席。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from a position of power by voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: With policies like that, he’ll be voted out in the next election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像那样的政策﹐下届选举他会被选下去的。

Sense.DEF: to approve a plan, law etc by voting
Sense.TRAN: 表决[投票]通过〔计划﹑法令等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposals were voted through yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些提议昨天表决通过了。

Sense.DEF: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote
Sense.TRAN: 投票〔指行为〕﹔投票选择﹔票数
Sense.EXAMPLE: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投我们的票是不会白投的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The House of Representatives approved the budget, with 52 votes in favor, 16 against and 12 abstentions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 众议院以52票赞成﹑16票反对﹑12票弃权批准了这项预算。

GramExa.GLOSS: vote in a political election
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harkin won 74 percent of the votes cast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈金获得了投票总数74%的选票。

Sense.EXAMPLE: policies designed to win votes in the South
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a group of people vote in order to decide something or choose a representative
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results of the vote were surprising – 80% of workers favoured strike action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票结果令人意外——80%的工人赞成罢工行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There will be a citywide vote all the voters in a particular city on the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将就此事进行一次全市范围的投票表决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unless anyone has anything to add, we’ll take a vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没人要补充什么﹐我们就投票表决吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have a vote on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对此事投票表决吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: decide something by voting
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s put it to the vote. All those in favor raise your hands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们来表决吧﹐所有赞成的人请举手。

Subsense.DEF: the total number of votes made in an election
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Davis won the election with 57% of the vote.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯以57%的选票当选。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Greens increased their share of the vote from 2.9 to 4.9%.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿党选票从2.9%上升到了4.9%。

Subsense.DEF: the right to vote in political elections
Subsense.TRAN: 〔政治选举中的〕投票权﹐选举权
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In France women didn’t get the vote until 1945.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法国﹐妇女直到1945年才获得选举权。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At that time black people did not yet have the vote.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时黑人还没有选举权。

Subsense.DEF: black, Jewish etc voters, or their votes
Subsense.TRAN: 黑人/犹太人/中产阶级等选民[选票]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The black vote is astonishingly loyal to the Democratic Party.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人选民对民主党出奇地忠诚。

Subsense.DEF: the total number of votes the Labour Party, Conservative Party etc win in an election
Subsense.TRAN: 工党/保守党/绿党等获得的选票
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Green vote looks likely to increase again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿党选票看来有可能再次增加。

Sense.DEF: the result of a vote
Sense.EXAMPLE: A close vote is expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计票数很接近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The motion was passed by a vote of 215 to 84.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个动议以215票对84票获通过。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are ready to support someone or something, or that you think that someone or something is the best of their kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anything that will mean a better deal for our children gets my vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡对我们孩子有好处的事我都赞成。

Sense.DEF: someone who is voted for in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pfeifer was the top vote-getter in last year’s election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在去年的选举中﹐法伊弗得票最多。

Sense.DEF: a process in which members of parliament vote in order to officially criticize the government for something
a formal process in which people vote in order to show that they support someone or something, especially the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: On April 19 the new government won a vote of confidence by 339 votes to 207.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月19日﹐新政府以339票对207票赢得信任投票。

Sense.DEF: something that you do or say that shows you support someone and approve of their actions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new investments are widely seen as a vote of confidence in the nation’s economic future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新的投资被普遍认为是对国家经济前景的支持。

Sense.DEF: a formal process in which people vote in order to show that they do not support someone or something, especially the government
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对政府的〕不信任投票﹐不信任表决

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On April 22 the National Assembly passed a vote of no confidence in the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月22日﹐国民议会通过了对政府的不信任投票。

Sense.DEF: something that you do or say that shows that you do not support someone

Sense.LEXUNIT: propose a vote of thanks (to sb)
Sense.DEF: to make a short formal speech in which you thank someone, especially at a public meeting or a formal dinner
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在公众集会或正式晚宴上〕(向某人)致谢词

Sense.DEF: someone who has the right to vote in a political election, or who votes in a particular election
Sense.TRAN: 选举人﹐投票人﹐选民﹔有投票权的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters overwhelmingly rejected the Far Right in the May elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在5月的选举中﹐选民普遍排斥极右政党。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Ireland 83% of voters favoured EC membership in 1972.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1972年﹐83%的爱尔兰选民赞成加入欧洲共同体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tory voters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党选民

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people who have the right to vote do not vote
Sense.TRAN: 选民的冷漠〔指许多有选举权的人不参加选举的情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voter apathy is especially high among young people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青年人中选民冷漠的情况特别突出。

Sense.DEF: an enclosed place where you can make your vote secretly
Sense.TRAN: 〔投票站里供秘密写选票用的〕投票亭﹐写票处

Sense.DEF: a machine that records votes as they are made
Sense.TRAN: 投票记录机﹐选票计算机﹔计票机

Sense.DEF: given or done because of a promise made to God or to a saint
Sense.TRAN: 〔对上帝或圣徒〕谢恩的﹐还愿的

Sense.DEF: to say that you firmly believe that something is true or good because of your experience or knowledge of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll vouch for the quality of the report. I read it last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为报告的质量作保﹐我昨晚看过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where were you on the night of the murder?’ ‘In bed with flu. My wife can vouch for that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谋杀发生当晚你在哪里？”“患流感卧床﹐我妻子可以作证。”

Sense.DEF: to say that you believe that someone will behave well and that you will be responsible for their behaviour, actions etc
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人的行为等〕作担保[保证]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you phone my office? They’ll vouch for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不打电话到我的办公室？ 他们会为我作证。

Sense.DEF: a ticket that can be used instead of money for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The voucher can be used at most major supermarkets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种购物券可以在大多数大型超市使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: First prize is a £1,000 travel voucher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头等奖是价值1,000英镑的旅行券。

Sense.DEF: an official statement or receipt that is given to some­one to prove that their accounts are correct or that money has been paid
to promise or offer something, or tell someone something that they can be certain is the truth
a serious promise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife’s killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆发誓要找到杀害他妻子的凶手。

Sense.DEF: a religious promise that you will do something for God, the church etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monk who had taken a vow of poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立誓守贫的僧侣

Subsense.DEF: the promises you make during your wedding
the promises you make when you become a Catholic priest or nun
Subsense.TRAN: 〔当神父或修女时立下的〕誓言

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I made a vow never to go near the place again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发誓再也不走近那个地方。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a vow at a formal ceremony
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Priests have to take a vow of obedience to the Catholic Church.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 神父必须立誓服从天主教会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do as you promised
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She kept her vow not to tell anyone about their affair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恪守誓言﹐没有向任何人透露他们的情事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fail to do as you promised
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She accused him of breaking his marriage vows.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指责他背弃了婚姻誓约。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make promises to each other as part of a wedding ceremony
have a second wedding ceremony to repeat your promises
a very serious vow, which you must keep
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He made a solemn vow that he would do everything he could to help her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他郑重发誓﹐要尽全力帮助她。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wrote her own marriage vows.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的结婚誓言是她亲自写的。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 禁语/守贫/禁欲等的誓言
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People close to him have finally broken their vow of silence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身边的人最终都违背了他们的禁语誓言。

Sense.DEF: to make a serious promise to yourself or someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Supporters have vowed to continue the protest until Adams is released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持者立誓一直抗议到亚当斯获释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I vowed that I would never drink again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发誓绝不再喝酒了。

Sense.DEF: to make a religious promise that you will do something for God, the church etc
one of the human speech sounds that you make by letting your breath flow out without closing any part of your mouth or throat
a letter of the alphabet used to represent a vowel. In English the vowels are a, e, i, o, u, and sometimes y.
Sense.TRAN: 元音字母〔英语的元音字母为a﹐e﹐i﹐o﹐u﹐有时也包括y〕

Sense.DEF: opinions expressed by ordinary people when they are asked questions about a particular subject during a television, radio, or newspaper report
Sense.TRAN: 民众之声﹐公众舆论〔指普通人在电视﹑广播或报纸报道中被问及某问题时所表达的看法〕

Sense.DEF: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
Sense.TRAN: 〔乘船或宇宙飞船的长途〕航行
Sense.EXAMPLE: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Titanic’s maiden voyage first journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “泰坦尼克”号的首航
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想独自航行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you learn a lot of new things about something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某事或某人有大量新发现的〕发现之旅
Sense.EXAMPLE: Writing a biography is an absorbing voyage of discovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撰写传记是极为有趣的发现之旅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voyage of self-discovery when you learn more about yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我发现之旅

Sense.DEF: to travel to a place, especially by ship
someone who makes long and often dangerous journeys, especially on the sea
Sense.TRAN: 航海者﹐海上探险者﹔〔长途〕旅行者

Sense.DEF: someone who gets sexual pleasure from secretly watching other people’s sexual activities
someone who enjoys watching other people’s private behaviour or suffering
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢窥探别人隐私的人
the abbreviation of 缩写= vice-president 副总统；副总裁
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= versus 对诉﹐对抗

Sense.DEF: a sign meaning peace or victory, made by holding up the first two fingers of your hand with the front of the hand facing forwards
Sense.TRAN: 胜利[和平]手势〔手心向外﹐伸出食指及中指做成V字形〕﹐V字手势

Sense.DEF: a rude sign made by holding up the first two fingers of your hand with the back of your hand facing towards another person
Sense.TRAN: V字形轻蔑侮辱手势﹐粗鲁[下流]的手势〔手背向外﹐竖起食指及中指〕

Sense.DEF: a British organization which sends people to developing countries for at least two years, to live and work there and to share their skills and knowledge with the local people
to make rubber stronger by using a special chemical treatment
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过化学处理〕使〔橡胶〕硫化﹔把〔橡胶〕强化

Sense.DEF: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way
not behaving politely in social situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: vulgar behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗俗的行为

Sense.DEF: not showing good judgment about what is beautiful or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vulgar check suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俗气的格纹套装

Sense.DEF: a fraction that is written as one number above a line and one number below it, and not as a decimal
the state or quality of being vulgar
vulgar remarks, jokes etc
to spoil the quality or lower the standard of something that is good
the Latin Bible commonly used in the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 拉丁通俗译本《圣经》﹐拉丁通行本《圣经》〔天主教普遍使用的文本〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children are most vulnerable to abuse within their own home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童在自己家里最易受到虐待。

Sense.DEF: a place, thing, or idea that is vulnerable is easy to attack or criticize
Sense.TRAN: 易受攻击的﹔易受责难的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fort was vulnerable to attack from the north.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个堡垒的北面易受进攻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their theories were badly thought out and very vulnerable to ridicule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的理论不够缜密﹐非常容易遭人取笑。

Sense.DEF: relating to foxes, or similar to a fox
a large bird that eats dead animals
someone who uses other people’s problems and suffering for their own advantage – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 趁火打劫的人﹐乘人之危的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hadn’t been dead five minutes before those vultures from the media were after his widow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尸骨未寒﹐媒体那帮家伙就对他的遗孀进行了围追堵截。

Sense.DEF: the outer part of a woman’s sexual organs
the present participle of vie
